Reviews.Content: Park Plaza New Orleans ex Radisson: AWFUL! DON'T GO!! I stayed at this hotel as there were no rooms available at other hotels in town. It was a real nightmare!When I entered my room, I felt a bad smell: there was urine in the bathroom, both on the basin ( full of yellow stains) and on the floor. I ran to the telephone, by the bed, to complain, and opened the linens, just to check... What a surprise when I found a huge blood stain on the linens!! Would you believe me if I tell you that NOBODY at Reception apologized for this? THey just told me: would you like us to clean it? Or do you prefer a new room?. Of course, I asked for another room... WHich was not better at all... NO blood, but also urine and pubic hairs and so on... I asked for a new change and they gave me what they called the suite. Apparently, the best room at the hotel... It turned out that the suite was not clean either. Tired, I called Housekeeping and gave them some money to clean the bathroom... They intended to clean it just with water!!!!! Even when it had clear marks of urine and other staff!! I asked them to use some bleach!Having a bath was another nightmare... Towels were FULL of PUBIC HAIRS! I asked for a change... And new towels were just the same. It seems that towels come with hairs at that hotel!No room service was available except from a pizza store nearby. Smell at the corridors was terrible! COuld you believe that rest of pizzas and dirty staff would remain at the corridors for more than 24 hours? Nobody picked them up!Elevators were old, worn out and always busy. Too many people going up and down all the time. The hotel was crowded, so you could hear screams and loud voices all the time.Because all of this, I complained to the General Manager of the hotel. He did not even seem surprised. It seemed that he was used to all this. There were signs all over stating that if any part of your stay was not pleasant, you won麓t pay for it. Of course, this is not true!! They even charge you extra money if you intend to shorten your stay at the hotel!I tried to write RADISSON to complain about this. It is a shame that a company like this offer this kind of service and hotel. But it seems that RADISSON IS NOT INTERESTED IN CUSTOMER麓S VOICE: at their web, they ask you to fill in lots of data and information about yourself and your complain. And finally, when you try to submit your complain, the system does not work and just inform you that it could not be sent. I tried to do this at least three times, on different days. Always the same!I know Radisson has sold this hotel, as they had too much headache with it. HOwever, I find them the only responsible for what I had to go through, as they were the owners at that moment. This is why I WILL NEVER RETURN TO A RADISSON HOTEL AGAIN IN MY LIFE!
Reviews.Author: Sil2006

Reviews.Content: Hopefully something's changed in 3 years Probably the worst hotel I've ever encountered in my life. Stayed there for a conference in October of 2003 and felt it ruined the entire thing. Tiny rooms, awful service, dirty, dirty, dirty...don't even try to eat there.
Reviews.Author: BrianneL

Reviews.Content: Never again Hotel is on the wrong side of Rampart, so area is a bit shakey. No assistance at the entrance. Requested a NON-smoking room, but entire hotel reeked of cigarette smoke. The front desk claimed that there were NO non-smoking rooms (contrary to resevations). Room had seen MUCH better days--hotel claimed to be undergoing reservations, but obviously had not reached our room. Lights did not work when we checked in.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Awful Located in a very bad part of town. Room was dirty. Linen was dirty. Was not brave enough to use the towels. Will never stay here again.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Danger, Danger, Danger It was by far the worse hotel that I鈥檝e ever stayed at. Parking cost extra, and the lot you get to park in is located next to the projects. The homeless live in the allies all around the hotel. When I got to my room there was someone else鈥檚 luggage already in my room. The bellhop had delivered it to the wrong room. The water did not work for most of my stay. I鈥檓 just glad that I only had to stay there one night.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: not recomended Stayed here for 4 nights in June unhelpful staff except for the guys in the bar who were great the restaurant was was open one night yet they advertise open nightly. Rooms were dirty when i complained they were less than helpful .The Hotel was also some distance from the centre in a rundown area
Reviews.Author: SiTarrant

Reviews.Content: Solid 2*       Park Plaza
Reviews.Author: Cruise,J.D.

Reviews.Content: Disgusting My husband and I left NYC for New Orleans to enjoy a relaxing 3 nights at the Park Plaza hotel. Little did we know that we'd have more satisfaction staying home and going to work. Don't get me wrong, we had a great time together when we were NOT in the hotel. New Orleans is a great city.Please take a moment to read the below bullet points:- The Park Plaza is located on a strip that resembles 125th street in Harlem  during the 80's.- We had to check in to 3 different rooms - the first one was unmade and dirty; the second stunk of cigarette smoke and the third one, although called a suite was a dump. Paper thin walls allowing all kinds of entertainment (vomitting, coughing, drunks banter) to enter our room at high decibles. - 2 out of 5 elevators were out of service, so you had to wait 20 minutes to get downstairs.- We found pubic hairs on our clean towels, as well as a turkey sandwich ordered from the nasty bar grill in the lobby.- The pool (which is on the 6th floor, not the roof) on the first night looked like a swamp - but we swam at our own risk as the temperature was near 112 degrees. It was drained and remained empty for the next 3 days.- When we complained to Frances, the front desk supervisor, she awarded us with 2 $22.00 vouchers for dinner at their restuarant Pralines, only to be told 30 seconds later, by Frances herself, that the restuarant would not be open for dinner. But we could feel free to eat at the sports bar (which is where the hair showed up in the turkey sandwich).There's plenty more but I'm beginning to relive it and feel queasy. We were offered a free 3 night stay with them in the future to make up for our disappointing time, but I'd rather spend time in Central Park in good old NYC than go back to that DUMP again. Do NOT stay at this place, even if it's all you can afford. Save for an extra month or 2 and stay closer to the Quarter and as far away from the Park Plaza as possible.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: It's not that bad My stay at the Park Plaza Hotel in New Orleans in July 2005 was okay. I only paid $100 a night so I wasn't expecting the Sheraton. It was not a luxury hotel and it served its purpose. I was there with another couple for the Essence Music Festival. There was so much activity outside of the hotel, I only stayed there long enough to get a couple of z's. The location of the hotel was pretty good. It was 3-4 blocks from the Superdome and 5-6 blocks from Bourbon Street, plus the street car was directly in front of the hotel. We were able to get around pretty easily either walking or catching the street car. My biggest complaint is that the walls are paper thin. I could hear the couple next door. a little too clearly if you know what I mean. However, my friends did not have the same problem with the thin walls. I would stay there again but it wouldn't be my first choice.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Not that bad I got a room here for $49 on Hotwire. I requested a renovated room, I can't imagine that is what I got, but it wasn't that bad. It was chipped and scratched, but comfortable with nice cherry wood furnture. A healthy person with comfortable shoes on will have no problem with the walk to the quarter. We walked all over the quarter, over to Frenchmen Street, to the French Market, the riverfront, and to the casino from there all in one night with no problem. I just had to forgo those cute high heels I was planning to hang out in. The hotel is a a block or two from the Ritz Carlton and the Fairmount, some of the better hotels in town, but in between these hotels and the Park Plaza is a spot where a lot of young soul brothers hang out and drink. They are probably harmless but might appear dangerous. There are also some ghetto fabulous jewelry shops, nail salons, and wig shops right adjacent to the Park Plaza, giving the immediate neighborhood a ghetto feel. But this zone is tiny. You are out of it in minutes. Parking is a pain. Be prepared to pay. The staff is nice and will go a bit but not too far out of their way to be helpful. All in all if you are a budget traveler and get a budget rate, this place will suit your needs, if you are not there are many nicer places to stay.We heard some wonderful teenage jazz musicians playing in the street at Canal and Bourbon, where you would enter the quarter if walking from the Park Plaza. I am not sure if they are always there, but try to catch them, it was the best music in the quarter.
Reviews.Author: lass=

Reviews.Content: Loved the Park Plaza Just got back from New Orleans and we had a great time! We stayed at the Park Plaza. The employees at the hotel were great. The hotel is a 100 years old which adds to the charm and makes you really feel like you are part of the New Orleans style. While it wasn't the Ritz, it was a great hotel and a super value. We felt safe here, especially compared to some other parts of New Orleans. Remember to be careful wherever you go in New Orleans. The trolley was convenient and easy to use. If we didn't feel like using the trolley we walked to the French Quarter and Bourbon Street, a short safe walk. New Orleans is a great place to visit and be prepared for a pretty wide open town. Bourbon Street was way too much fun and the Swamp tours, Plantations and Aquarium were wonderful. We will go back again soon and when we do we will try to stay at the Park Plaza again.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Okay We found this hotel okay. The rooms, lobby, bar area were just ok. I found the staff rude and unhelpful (apart from a bellhop who was friendly and a barmaid who was excellent).The room was average but clean. The pool was out of service during our stay, partly due to weather but also because of maintenance, although we never saw anybody working on it.The Pizza/fast food cafe within the bar was mediocre. The night we arrived they didnt have any pizzas and had run out of half the things on the menu. when I asked for some cutlery the server shrugged and sighed because she had to walk two feet to fetch it for me. It was also advertised as opening at 7.30am but it didnt actually open until 10am (I wanted food at 7.30am the day we were checking out) but had to ask another rude receptionist.The information computer in the lobby that gives tourist information is also out of date.There is a trolley that runs right outside the hotel every 15 minutes down to bourbon street if the walk is too far, but we found it ok. We found the hotel value for money but had just a few minor issues.
Reviews.Author: bmills

Reviews.Content: Awesome Professional Service Ms. Carol Jackson is the most professional individual I have ever met at any hotel. She is courteous, and handles things in a very calm professional manner. I also watched her with others and was impressed with her professionalism.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Caveat Emptor We stayed at the Park Plaza on July 6 - 10, 2005, only because we were attending a large convention-like event at the hotel. After reading the many, many negative reviews, we expected the worse. The negative reviews are right on target. Like others have said, the place is a dump, located near the projects, about five very long blocks from the French Quarter/ Central Business District. When we checked into the hotel, kids from the neighborhood were in the lobby begging for money right under the eye of the doorman (who I rarely saw opening the door during our stay). The deluxe room we were assigned on the 3rd floor was totally unacceptable, not only because it provided a view of a large HVAC unit just a a few feet beyond our window, but because of the smell, frayed carpet, peeling wallpaper, moldy bathroom, leaking toilet, and rattling HVAC vent. The lady at the front desk was apparently used to complainers like us because she promptly reassigned us, no questions asked, to a deluxe room on the 16th floor, which was even more unihabitable than the original room assignement due to the strong stench of urine in the hallway. Upon returning to the lobby, we complained to a very nice woman wearing a hotel badge, who turned out to be the security manager. She introduced us to the hotel manager, who was very sympathetic and reassigned us to a deluxe room on the 9th floor, which was significantly better than the two other rooms, but still one of the worst hotel rooms we have ever stayed in. Other than offering a large ballroom for the event we were attending, the hotel amenities were sparse. The breakfast buffet was edible, but that particular restaurant closes after lunch, leaving the cafeteria located in the bar as the only other on-site place to eat. The bar area, however, smelled like rotting seaweed, which pretty much killed the desire to eat the stuff they sell as food.As others have pointed out, the neighborhood is a serious concern. While we did not experience any problems the few times we walked to the French Quarter during the day, the potential for crime is certainly high, day or night, particularly for the elderly and those who are small in size or physically weak. Although the street car does stop in front of the hotel for a relatively safe form of transport up and down canal street even at night, a taxi is the only sure bet for safe travel.I suspect that many people who book at the Park Plaza shop for price and think they are getting a bargain. For as little as $15 more per night, however, there are plenty of other hotels located in or very close to the French Quarter/Central Business Distrct that are much nicer than this dump.
Reviews.Author: Laby

Reviews.Content: More work to go on this vacation I visited New Orleans and stayed at this hotel with my best friend during the last week of June. Out of the 5 days that I had booked, we only stayed for 4 days. This is my first time posting to this site and after reading some of the other reviews, I noticed that a lot of my problems were the same. I had specifically told the agent when I made the arrangements that we would be needing late check in. Upon arrival to the hotel, I even called an hour ahead to confirm and remind. When we arrived we were met with a double booked room. I had to wait 45 minutes to finally be helped and then another 10 minutes until they could tell me which room due to this problem on their part. There was not any valet/bell hop service to speak of upon arrival. We didn't even know where to park our car if there was self park. My best friend was shuttled back to the hotel from self park by someone of valet service in that person's own personal car. This made me feel completely uneasy. When we reached our room, it had peeling paint on the door, the security bolt had been pulled away from the door rendering it useless, a large sticky damp stain on the carpet in front of the bathroom and our closet had also been used as a restroom complete with a urine permeating smell. The bed was not comfortable and, it did feel like you were sleeping on box springs. Our ice bucket nor our glasses that were in the room were sanitized or changed out. Our door key also did not work on quite a few occassions and the door would not close completely due to the security bolt that would get in the way of closing the door.The pool was filthy. Out of the 4 days that we were there the jacuzzi worked only 2. The pool area was not picked up and after the towels ran out they were left littering the area for 3 days straight. There was a definate saltiness about the water in the pool. There were also toe nails and fake hair that were left in the jacuzzi that were there the following day.We left after night three because it became too much work on our mini vacation to constantly complain and request services that should have been provided.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Not as close to bourbon as stated! It was me and my best friend we stayed here for the weekend. Check in was fine, but our room was okay. It was smelly but whatever, we immediately left for bourbon! bourbon was great, but the walk is too far for two women to be walking at night. It is 7 blocks down the strret but it is really far esp. after a fun night. Our tub did not drain well at all..after I took a shower like two hours later there was still my water in the tub! not cute. so we decided to change rooms. that was fine and easy but we did not get room service for the rest of our stay there!! which was like 3 more days! The bell guys were nice and helpful, but the front desk people had no sense of treating their guests the greatest. When we first arrived there was this huge cockroach outside the hotel that chased me! Now i am from florida and I've seen roaches but this was huge with a mind of its own..plus when we left, I noticed it again-maybe it was his sister! we stayed at this place because it was part of a package that was $308..not bad I thought for a whole weekend. But i know when I go back, I will def want to stay closer to bourbon street not to mention closer to everything else. I came to find out that we were literally two streets down from the projects...and at night when we walked back from the awesome Harra's casino, I knew we were not staying in a nice place when the street lights got dimmer. I would DEF recommmend staying at the holiday Inn off Bourbon or the marriot..more further down the street from this place since this is not a safe place at night, even if you ride the trolleys.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Bad bed The bed felt like sleeping on box springs. It was flat and I could feel the springs but somehow I managed to sleep. The parking lot is across the street and across the street from the back of the parking lot is a housing project. Didn't feel good about leaving my car there but it survived. You can catch a street car in front of the hotel to take you the few blocks down to bourbon st. Lots of riff raff on the streets. Would be a great city if not for all the poverty.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: would definitely Not recommend I stayed at the Park Plaza in New Orleans last week when I was in New Orleans for business. To preface this review, i'd like to say that i'm definitely NOT a hotel snob. If a place is clean with decent service, its good enough for me.As for the Park Plaza Hotel, I found the rooms to be extremely old. They were decently clean, but the first thing I thought when walking into my room was wow, what a dump. The elevators in the hotel were possibly the slowest elevators in the world. There was an old, stale air stench in the room. The lock on my door wouldn't always work with my keycard, i had to swipe the card sometimes 20 times in order for my door to unlock. Several times I had to get my keycard re-programed. The walls are paper thin, I could clearly hear everything said from the room adjacent to mine, and even some conversations in the rooms across the hall.The good: AC is strong and makes the room cold quickly. The employees are very friendly. Close (walking distance) to the French Quarter. Cheap rates ($79/night).Next time I visit New Orleans, I will definitely try other accomodations.
Reviews.Author: tluv

Reviews.Content: U R (not) IN Luck! I've never written a review about a hotel before, UNTIL I stayed here for 3 days... 3 days too long! Granted the price was a bargain, but what I paid for in being just offended was NOT. The staff wasn't really an issue but I could only get a 2 bed room if I did the $25 upgrade so bait and switch right away. The room was spacious but we eventually found an odor in the closet. Yeah, you guessed it, someone thought it was the bathroom. After we changed rooms the next day, we got a smaller but nicer room which was less smelly, but the hallways to this room was another makeshift bathroom. I don't know if you've ever smelt old human (unrine) indoors, but it just permeates everything! Parking was close as there is a hospital parking deck around the corner of the main entrance on the next block for $6/day. The area isn't the projects but it isn't a family or a date walk to Bourbon either. You must be street smart (actually that goes for all of the FQ). Loose clothes, wallets in front pockets, alert eyes, watch for people working together - even the kids. I'd only walk it with a bunch of guy friends and you'll be at Bourbon in 10 minutes. Otherwise, a cab ride is the right thing to do. Lesson learned: Stay somewhere nicer because its worth it!
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Nice Hotel bad location We stayed at this hotel in May 2005, we arrived at 2pm to be told we couldn't check in until 4pm, however on our day of departure we had to leave by 11am, but that's another story. The hotel itself is ok, it used to be a Radisson but I don't think it is Radisson standard. The lobby areas are nice and clean, however it was very busy and took a while to check in. Our room was on the 8th floor at the end and was probably the smallest room in the hotel, but it was clean. The real problem is the location, it is on Canal St but at the top end and you have to walk past some dodgy and derelict buildings to get to the French Quarter. The tram does stop outside the hotel though. Parking is very expensive, Self parking in a dodgy looking car park is $15 per day and Valet parking is $28. When we did walk we walked past a lot of nicer hotels near the French Quarter.
Reviews.Author: MikeandDonnaLaycock

Reviews.Content: Great Deal! Although the building is old (built in the 1920's) it was a great bargain. We paid $79/night and couldn't have been happier with what we got. We read the reviews and like most people were nervous. But we felt relieved at check in with great service. We spoke with the front desk manager Scott and he agreed the hotel has some issues but they only want their guests to be happy and we were. The room was slightly worn but we weren't paying $200/night so we didn't expect the Ritz. But it was comfortable and clean and the staff (especially the front desk and belldesk) were friendly and accomodating. We will stay there again this summer.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Park Plaza Not Fit For Humans Do not stay at this hotel! We booked a room for $59/night (conference rate), thinking it would be on par with a Best Western or Travel Lodge (i.e. no frills but clean). 3 stars? Not in a developed country! This hotel has no standards. There is certainly a good reason that it is no longer a Radisson property. It needs several million $ in upgrades to make it fit for human habitation. We requested a quiet room away from the elevators (we read the reviews here also--yes the walls are very thin). The most disturbing part of our stay was the cockroach (dusty and dead for quite some time - presumably from the filth), renovated bathroom (complete with hairs from previous guests) and stained towels (semi-white towels with yellowish stains). Rooms are dark, with two phones (yet only one bedside light), disgustingly dingy bathrooms (with mildew), dirty windows and dirty/dusty furniture. We packed up the morning after water started dripping from our bathroom ceiling...we were told it was bathwater from the room above (the guest failed to properly use the shower curtain). Instead of packing our things and moving to another room, we packed and moved to another hotel (The Fairmont is 2 blocks away--well worth twice the price). The staff are nothing to write home about either! When we checked out, we had a mysterious $5 food and beverage charge, nothing big, but we certainly would not consume anything prepared from this hotel. This charge was charged seperately to our credit card after we had checked out - our credit card company is currently investigating. Interestingly, the clerk who checked us out (and removed the questionable charge) was dubbed the Improvement Manager. The location is fairly good...two blocks from Ritz-Carlton, McDonalds and Walgreens, although I didn't feel comfortable seeing my wife walk to conference centre (20 minute brisk walk) alone. I wouldn't walk alone at night near hotel--but streetcar stop is directly across street. If you choose to stay here, don't forget to request toilet paper and bring your own linens.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Glad we made the move to this place!!! We visited New Orleans from April 21 to May 3 for the Jazz and Heritage Festival. After a horrid experience at the so-called Grand Palace down the street, we inquired and got a room at the Park Plaza (for less than half what we were paying a night at the Grand Palace; it was the end of the first weekend of the Jazz and Heritage Festival so I guess the rates dropped considerably). We had actually had breakfast twice at Pralines at the Park Plaza and decided to inquire about rates there since we were not happy at all with the Grand Palace after just two days. We promptly went and checked out, got our bags and checked into the Park Plaza at 11 a.m. and went to our room. Everyone from the doorman to the baggage handlers to the concierge to the front desk were quite accommodating and helpful. The gentleman who helped us with our luggage even went and got us some ice (it was a really hot day!) and shared some local fun spots to visit while there. The concierge also was very helpful with restaurant choices around town, and all were excellent! We enjoyed the hotel sports bar, the pool, the hot tub, the fitness center and excellent room service. The streetcar was very convenient and took us just about everywhere we needed to go so fortunately a rental car was not needed for our stay. We did have to take a cab a few times and all the doormen were great at hailing one for us. Three small things that I was not real happy with: 1) The laundry room was very small and hot and needed a good paint job, and the dryers were broken the evening we tried to do laundry and it took maintenance a while to take care of that, but the staff was nice enough to dry my clothing in the house laundry and bring to my room later. 2) The business center internet service charged me $10.60 to check my email (WHOA!!!) which took me less than 3 minutes. 3) Housekeeping was very prompt when we needed anything, but I did have to call the supervisor to tell them to keep the loud talking and laughter down at 8 a.m. two mornings in a row right outside our door, which was close to the elevator.Other than that, we truly enjoyed our stay, would recommend this hotel, and would likely stay again on our next visit to beautiful New Orleans.
Reviews.Author: nightowl800

Reviews.Content: The Worst Hotel I've ever stayed in! My wife and I stayed at the Park Place Hotel and were very unhappy and felt unsafe. Appauled with the hotels cleanliness and upkeep. Rooms are musty and unclean. Our bathroom was aged with mold in corners and crusty stuff on toilet seat. Unprofessionaly painted walls to cover the aging doors etc. to make them look new! An offensive odor carries throughout the hotels lobby and halls, moldy a/c vents are another sore eye. Most of the Hotel staff were friendly and polite. We were given the wrong room and had to stay in another. I would not reccomend this hotel!
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Pleasant People equal Pleasant If you are looking for a hotel where people are friendly and very helpful this is a great place. The rooms are clean , the hotel bar is outstanding, is located nicely(between Burbon and Casino) and people are outstanding.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Not Bad At All          Pool
Reviews.Author: SandalsPrincess

Reviews.Content: Great hotel for the price We were very concerned when we read reviews...but it was worth the stay. It was about a 5 block walk to Bourbon... but you can ride the streetcar RIGHT outside the hotel. They accomodated all we needed... the food was good at the little snack bar section... The bar was great, and has happy hour every day from 11a-7p. Our room was cleaned daily, and new towels provided daily. I think that the comments about the neighborhood are exaggerated. In all honesty, all of New Orleans has those that are standing around and has its share of homeless... If you are rating your hotel or the location because of that, then you don't need to go to New Orleans. The Ritz Carlton is 2 blocks down.... so obviously it can't be THAT bad of a neighborhood!It was well worth the money... We stayed in an oversized room and it was huge! Only bad thing that happened was my husbands phone was stolen from the pool area.
Reviews.Author: michaelandbetsi

Reviews.Content: Worth about $15 a night Thankfully, I got a cheap rate for this hotel. The lobby is nice, the staff were friendly, and the elevators worked just fine. We were on the 8th floor (837 I think) and for the hours I was in the room (generally 6am-12pm), I didn't really hear anyone else up. Mostly I heard the cleaning staff from 3 or 4 doors down. The walls are thin. The room was small, but not uncomfortably so. The mattress had seen better days...kinda flat like cardboard. The beds were made daily and fresh, though stained, towels were also supplied without any problems. The problem: The Bathroom - it was gross. Mold all over the bathtub walls - the part of the tub that should be in the wall had jutted foward and was black with mold. The shower curtain was moldy. The bathroom was not cleaned once during the 8 nights we were there. The toilet bowl had a gross ring around it. By checkout day, there were bugs running around the room. The location wasn't a problem for me...the rash I got on my legs was a problem. The place just was not clean...showering was the worst part of my day each day. If you have to stay here, bring or pick up some Clorox Clean Up and bring shower shoes. Definitely will not stay here again...I'd rather pay more and get better, cleaner accomms. The best thing about the Park Plaza was leaving it and going to a better hotel.
Reviews.Author: NoVa_NoLa

Reviews.Content: would stay again After reading the below average reviews here we still booked our JazzFEST 2005 trip here. A group of ours went down and while I Can't speak for the others I hear there were no major complaints. Jazzfest is like spring break for adults so the place was packed, sold out. Our flight arrived early and although I was told check in was at 4 they were able to check us in at 1pm. The process was quick and easy. We got lucky, and your experience may vary depending on the previous guest! I was nervous of the room, again because of these reviews, but was quite pleased. We stayed in 805 and the two full sized beds were fine and the pull out couch didn't take up too much of the room when pulled out. Comfortably the room fit 3. The bathroom was also fine, no leaks, no bugs, just a functional bathroom. Room included an iron and ironing board which was nice. I travel frequent for work and sometimes this has to be ordered! Housekeeping was prompt and cleaned well, even delivered the extra blanket we requested quickly. The part of Canal street this is on isn't the best part of town(is there a best in NOLA??), but just a few doors down from the theatre Gavin McGraw performed at and a few streets down from the Ritz Carlton and Bourbon street the location was perfect. Street car drops off right in front for easy access (why rent a car?) and the concierge was helpful for booking the swamp tour and eating recommendations. The roof top pool and hot tub(on the 6th floor), was a nice touch with good weather. The one complaint I can think of is that the walls were thin, so if your neighbors are loud, you will hear them. Other than this the place was fine, and I would definitely stay here again. Based on location/price/ammenities I rate this hotel above average.
Reviews.Author: joelsindc

Reviews.Content: Wouldn't stay again Overall summary = Would I stay here again? No. Worth $279 per night? No.Positives= Rooms looked nice (nice furniture, drapes). lobby looked nice.Was not as bad as I expected after reading tripadvisor.com, and wasn't the worst thing in the world considering we had a lot of trouble finding a room this weekend (Jazz Fest.)NEGATIVES:All of my towels but one were stained with something or other.Only two pillows.I woke up this morning with my back thrown out (springy bed).General mood of hotel can be a little depressing -- seems to be a place for frat boys, and people smoking the lobbies of various floors.The location is okay, but really too far to walk to Bourbon St. etc.A little bit of mildew in the bathroom.Bathroom only has a sink -- no counter (except a tiny shelf).Small rooms, low ceilings.A lot of light comes in from all around the door of my room, and the door does not seem to lock well. Also, therefore a lot of noise also comes in from the hallway, cleaning staff and other guests.They didn't clean my room until at least 1:30, which is a pain.If you're really having trouble getting a hotel, get this one, but if you have a choice, go to the Hilton Riverside!
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Avoid it!!!! If all you want is a bed, it's an expensive one. The staff is rude. The rooms are not overly clean. For example they placed two disgustingly stained coffee mugs in our room to go with our coffee maker. They are not prompt when there is a problem. Our floor was soaked from either a leak or the cleaning crew. We reported it to four different people and nothing was ever done about it. The hotel is NOT four blocks from the French Quarter as advertised (it's closer to two or three miles) - eight trolley stops. Also, nobody knows when any of their facilities close. We got three different answers on when the deli quit serving food (all of which were wrong). The pool facilities have several different closing time posted depending on where you look for the info. The hot tub was broken on our second day there adn it was already truning a gross gree, but there was no sign advising people to beware, no staff working on it, or concerned about it (the manager didn't even know it wasn't working!) Overall, stay away from this hotel!!
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Stay here if you love nasty hotels with rude staff Our first room was a nice size. That's the only nice thing I can think of. My toddler had black feet within an hour of taking his shoes off and letting him run around barefoot. The toiletries in the gas-station-clean bathroom were really just a bunch of different kinds of hair conditioner. By the end of my shower I was standing in 4 inches of water. We could hear every single word our neighbors said, and after they started yelling and throwing things at 2 am, we contacted security. They came up and joked around with the neighbors and that was it for security. We asked for a room change the next morning, so we packed up all of our stuff and stored it for the day while they cleaned another room for us. The next room appeared to be a bit cleaner and was quieter. We unfortunately left a couple items in the room which housekeeping took. The hotel would not give us any sort of discount for our first night and said they did us a favor by putting us in another room, and did nothing about the neighbors who ended up breaking a window. I've stayed in Motel 6's that were nicer. We didn't check this site before booking. For the cost, it would be cheaper to stay out by the airport and take a taxi into town.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Good value for those who want a clean  For those who have just purchased this hotel through Hotwire or Priceline, don't panic! I did, and when I read some of the reviews here I wanted to forfeit the $$ and stay somewhere else. I am glad, however, that I did not. The Park Plaza is just fine--it was safe, clean, and the staff was very friendly. If you are concerned about the quality of room you may get, I suggest you call the hotel ahead of time and request a newly rennovated one, which is what I did. The hotel is older and the bathrooms attest to its age, but they are very clean and servicable. The pillows are very flat (they resemble airline ones) and the walls are quite thin (I could hear someone sneeze in the next room), but otherwise I had few complaints. Do not use the valet parking for $26 a night. There is a lot behind the hotel off LaSalle street that is connected to Tulane Hospital in which you can park for $5 a day--a very safe and much cheaper alternative! The Canal street trolley to the French Quarter is another cheap option for getting around. It stops right in front of the hotel, runs 24/7, and is $1.25 each way.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Not Bad at All       Huge room
Reviews.Author: rock_botttom

Reviews.Content: Park Plaza New Orleans = good deal for penny-pinchers still wanting some quality The price was great from lastminutetravel for the French Quarter Festival weekend. Hotel room was small, but had all the amenities we needed. Bathroom was clean and towels were clean. The view was nice. The rooftop pool and hot tub were okay. Air Conditioning worked. Staff was friendly. Walls were thin; could hear doors slamming and people talking in next room, as well as toilets flushing next door. About a 10-minute walk from Bourbon Street through a run-down area, which could be scary. Saw only 1 rat in the street. Overall, it was great for a frugal-minded girl like me. Do not use valet; use the Tulane Medical parking garage for $6.50 per day, about 陆 a block over.
Reviews.Author: Anjiggy

Reviews.Content: No problems, Great Stay, Nice Rooms Stayed at the Park Plaza three nights during French Quarter Festival. (2 Couples). Had a great time, rooms were very nice, minor issues handled quickly and to our satisfaction..First off, for a high rise, this is an older hotel built in the twenties. It is currently undergoing another upgrade. Rooms are being redone. (this is the one problem we encountered as we were originally sent to a room under construxtion.Pros - Good price. Clean. Service staff were very friendly except for one desk clerk who was curt and businesslike, and even he promptly addresseed the issue. Rooms were quiet, well appointed and spacious. Pool looked nice with large patio, but we did not use it. Also directions and cabs, etc., were provided accurately and promptly by bell staff.Cons - Bathrooms are small and plain as this is old hotel. Water in shower changes temps quite frequently. Everytime someone flushes or turns on their shower. Walk to FQ is not through the best of neighborhoods. However, we walked at all hours of day and night and only had one minor incident (Woman wanted me to share my adult beverage with her and shouted at me when I refused.)Didn't try the restaurant or bar.
Reviews.Author: sschafe48170

Reviews.Content: Wonderful Service My organization had its 25th Anniversary celebration at the Park Plaza Hotel in March. We had over 400 persons to attend. The overall rating consensus from our participants was excellent.I would like to give a special thanks to Ernejean Toney--Event Manager and Sherry Harvey--Convention Services Director. These are two wonderful ladies that were very hospitable and accomodating. They went over and beyond to make our stay and celebration very desirable and successful.We would denifitely recommend the Park Plaza Hotel for accomodations and events!!!
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Stay somewhere else! Where to begin with the Park Plaza. Well, the front desk staff is rude. Lightbulb in our bathroom flashed like a disco ball. It was very Saturday Night Fever in there until it was fixed (to their credit-they did fix it promptly). There was a leak in the bathtub liner, rotten water gathered underneath and smelled like rotton eggs. It was like you were surfing in the shower, which didn't drain either. Later that day the room reaked, so we asked to change. After 4-5 room changes (they couldn't seem to give us keys to a room that was made up), we got a room that was half the size of the other, albeit with a better bathroom. Vomit stains on the carpet were a nice touch. There is a cool pool and hot tub area, but both are full of trash and the hot tub water was lukewarm and green. This place ain't cheap either. It worked out OK b/c all we did was crash there after partying on Bourbon St, but I wouldn't stay there again!
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Just okay Not as bad as some of the reviews I read. It appeared to be relatively clean, but the roach in the bathroom ruined my 2-day stay.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Don't Stay here or Sleep in your Car cause that will cost $15 a night..! O my goodness the reviews are correct...!!! This place ---, I have recieved better service from Motel 6 then this place. You can only check in after 4 pm we were there at 10, 1, and 3 and there reply to us was Check-In is at 4. The staff was run by Ghetto --- people that were so --- rude...! Parking is $20 a night as well. There is a as why the Radisson sold this place.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Great Value, No problems! Just got back from a trip to N.O. and stayed at the Park Plaza, having booked it at an excellent value on priceline. Staff were all friendly and helpful at check in, when we needed to store our bags after checkout, and with anything we needed during the stay. Room service was excellent, with a complete and thourough cleaning, remaking bed, and restocking supplies daily. Room wasn't huge, but had great view and was very clean. Furnishings were nice, starting to show just a little wear and tear. Water went out one night but was back on by morning. Location good, right on streetcar line, but most times we just walked to FQ, about 6 blocks right down Canal St. passing a few run down blocks but we never had any problems day or night. I'm sure you could find another hotel in N.O. that was perfect in every way but certainly not for anything close to this price! Definitely stay here unless you are of the extra picky sort and plan to sulk in the hotel room instead of getting out and enjoying the city.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: It was great We stayed 4 nights at this hotel. After reading the reviews on here we were scared but when we arrived everything was great. The staff was very nice and the room was clean. We reserved the hotel on priceline for $40 a night, an excellent price for spring break. The hotel is located very close to Bourbon street and within walking distance of the Aquarium and Harrah's. Parking turned out much better than expected, Tulane emergency room is less than a block away and has a parking garage that provides 6.25 a day parking. I would definately stay at this hotel again.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: I thought I had Traveled back to a bygone era I guess I'm kind of old fashioned. I don't go for places with allot of glitter and hype, or places where the courtesy comes with a rip-off price. For Mardi-Gras this year I stayed at the Park Plaza in New Orleans. I knew there was allot of bashing going on about this place but friends who had stayed told me otherwise. I found the location to be pretty good -- right on the famous streetcar line to take me up to the Garden District, French Quarter, or the Harrah's in a few minutes. It is located at one end of the business district, not far from the French Quarter. In fact I preferred to walk to most of the attractions since it wasn't far and I like to burn a few extra calories when I'm eating that yummie creole cuisine. The hotel building itself looks like a typical 20th century brick hotel but don't let the exterior fool you. The interior has been completely redone, modernized and renewed without losing any of the charm of the time when hotels were palaces that the rich called their second home. We spent a full week at this hotel so were able to experience all of its attributes. The staff were busy but pleasant and helpful, the doormen always smiling and attentive. Off the lobby was a pretty good snack and attractive pizza shop with pool tables and cafe style seating. There too was a nice bar, and a great restruant for breakfast buffets. The artwork, antique furniture, gilded mirrors, and plush 30s style decor made me feel that I was in a bygone era, a very relaxing, gentle era. We had very good room service as far as cleaning and resupply. Every night our bed was prepared, towels fresh, and everything spotless. I realize that at the height of mardi gras madness and crowding that I should have expected less but I found way more than I expected. I don't know why someone would want to bash this fine historic hotel but for me, it's a place that I'll return to as often as I can and reccommend highly to anyone else who enjoys the feeling of being emersed in the warm southern hospitality of a bygone era when the customer was treated as a welcome guest.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Park Plaza, New Orleans We stayed at the Park Plaza (formerly Radison) during the weekof Mardi Gras and the hotel was very busy. I felt the hotel staff did a great job dealing with the needs of the guests during this busy and crazy holiday. Many of the guests were very difficult too since they were celebrating heavily (drinking). Our room was great, very comfortable with nice funishings. Our room service was great and every day our room was cleaned perfectly with plenty of fresh towels. I found the hotel staff to be very polite and friendly too. I did feel sorry for the staff, having to deal with so many rude customers, especially the maids who had to clean up after some of the parties that were held in the rooms. I peeked in a few and they had been trashed. Overall I was very happy with all of the service that we received during our 7 day stay at the Park Plaza. All of our needs were quickly met, including help arranging tours, information on the area, access to the safe deposit and getting cabs. This is the second time that we have stayed at the Park Plaza, and our last stay in 9/04 was just as good. I have read some of the reviews left on this site for the Park Plaza and just don't understand how our stays have been so great and these folks have such rude things to say. Yet after seeing some of the rude people staying there during Mardi Gras I think that the reviews are left by this small group of inconsiderate customers and that the people happy with their stay don't think about leaving a comment. I would recommend this hotel to everyone, and felt it's proximity to the French Quarter was good, especially with the trolley stop in front of the hotel. When we return again, we plan to stay at the Park Plaza.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: More than we expected There is a term the locals use which is lanyappe meaning you get more than you ask for or expect, and we did! We reserved a standard room and got a suite with a king size bed and all the amenities, at no additional cost. The room was clean  comfortable and the staff was friendly, courteous and helpful. The hotel is at 1500 Canal street which is centrally located to all the tourist attractions. The streetcar stops right in front of the hotel providing convenient transportation throughout the city. The hotel concierge set up the various tours we were enterested in and saw that we were picked up  returned to our hotel as an additional courtesy, each day. When it was time to leave, the hotel had a taxi waiting to take us to the airport. We were treated like VIP's and they truly lived up to the word lanyappe.Joan Hall Olivia, NC
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: The most DISGUSTING hotel I've ever seen!!! My fiancee and I checked into the hotel around 12:30am and checked out by 2:00am. The hotel overall is very, very dirty and very, very, run down. Our room was really small and the carpet and curtains were very stained. Upon pulling back the bed covers we found many body hairs on the sheets and pillow cases. Obviously the sheets had not been changed from the prior guests. When we made the decision to check out the lady at the front desk was very impolite and would not refund our money. After finding a room at the Slepp-Inn, I immediately called Expedia and they refunded all of our money that night. I would not recommend this hotel to my worst enemy and it should not even be rated as a 1 star hotel let alone a 3 star. STAY AWAY!
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: it was OK i thought it was pretty good. I had to pay $150.00/night because of the timing/overbooked status, but everything was clean and neat. Yeah you could here doors close, but that happens when there are 48 doors on one hallway. Walls were thin, but i just turned up the TV and that drained the noise out when there was some.i got a small bed the first night, booked a room with a king bed, went down the next morning to complain and they gave me a queen bed. The guy in front of me was trying to book any kind of room and they didnt give him anything. So the staff was as nice as the could be, since they were way overbooked.room was kind of small. but i didnt go to New Orleans to sit in my room and complain about how much room i didnt have. You could still sleep about 4 or 5 people on the floor is you a real cheap college student like me.ill stay again if i can get a better rate.03/11/2005
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: You get what you pay for! This is an older hotel that has not seen much work in recent years. We had the smallest room I could imagine with one tiny window that looked out into the bowels of the hotel. It was dark to say the least. The room was dirty, the towels were stained, and I decided not to look at the sheets for fear of not wanting to sleep there. The room was quiet as we had an end room. The TV did work as did the A/C and heat. The toliet and tub were stained and very old, but everything worked. I could take the hotel if the walk to the Quarter wasn't so hairy. It was fine for me (a tough enough looking guy) but there is no way I would feel my girlfriend or parents would be safe. I got asked for money even late at night and saw some things that made me want to walk faster. The food at the hotel is a joke, so you will be going to the Quarter for all your meals (which is where you should be anyway). Be prepared for a taxi or the street car if you don't like walking through the run down hood. With so many hotels closer to the Quarter I would advise anyone to look somewhere else.
Reviews.Author: pharmco

Reviews.Content: Gross.....can I say any more? Three friends and I stayed at the Park Plaza before going on a cruise to Mexico. We did not expect much, but our low expectations were not met. The room was smaller then our bottom of the line cruise room, and wasn't put together correctly. The front desk staff did not care about our well-being and were rude to us on the phone. We stayed in a non-smoking room that needed to be fumigated. We tried to switch, but after thirty minutes of waiting on the phone, everything was booked. The towels had yellow stains on them and the bed sheets had red stains. We even found hair in the basket with the shampoo. We rushed in and out, and tried to spend the least amount of time in the hotel room. I would highly suggest looking elsewhere before booking here.
Reviews.Author: redletterboy

Reviews.Content: What's all the fuss about? Our stay was great! I made the fatal mistake of stumbling onto this website after I had booked my room. Boy, reading some of these posts had me almost dreading our trip. I was so concerned that I called the hotel and informed them of all the ugly press I had read. They said they were sorry to hear this and understood my fears. I was assured our stay would be a good one. Well, this was not good enough for me. So, the next day I called and spoke directly with the GM. I explained the same things to him - that I was very nervous after all that I had read. He too told me he would personally see to it that we would enjoy our stay. Still, my fears ceased to wane.However, upon checking in with a very nice front desk clerk, we got our keys and opened the door to a very nice and very huge corner suite. The room must have been at least 1000 square feet! I suppose we were given this room due to our calls, but hey, they did live up to their promise like they said. We were very happy with it, and for $90 a night it was well worth it.Our room number was 444. Ask for that room is possible and I think you will enjoy your stay too. The hotel is not perfect, and is definitely showing a little wear, but I wouldn't hesitate to stay there again. All in all it was a very good experience. Have a good time!
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Terrible Hotel/Scary location.. Went down for the Sugar Bowl in which VA Tech beat Auburn on the field. This hotel was close to the SuperDome. That is all that I can say as positive. Evertything else was horrible beyond belief.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: You get what you pay for! Just returned from a 3 night stay at the Park Plaza. We also booked through Hotwire for $49. After reading the reviews, I really expected a dive and I was pleasantly surprised. The hotel was clean and quiet during our stay. However, this is not a three star hotel. The hotel is worn and has seen it's better days. Yes, the paint is chipped, the tub stained, and the towels are worn (like mine at home!), but the room was clean.I found the staff to be friendly and helpful. We were upgraded to a double room with two beds for $49! Which was nice since I was traveling with my 17 year old son. The walk to the French Quarter takes you past abandoned several abandoned buildings. Yes, there are kids and homeless men hanging out the street and people waiting to catch buses. We walked to the FQ every day at various times of day and night and never had any problems or felt uneasy. Parts of New Orleans are old and dirty and this is one of them!!! The walls are thin and we were lucky not to be bothered by noise staying midweek. Overall, the hotel was fine. Would I stay there again? For $49, I'd consider it. Would I recommend it? To my mother - no; to a budget minded co-worker - probably. Remember - you get what you pay for!
Reviews.Author: NW_Family_of_5

Reviews.Content: Does the management even care? Based on the reviews, I see that my wife  I were not alone in our MULTIPLE problems with this hotel during our one night stay. Here is my list on the room and staff in no particular order:Room (and I'm really not making any of this up):-Only one light in whole room worked, very dark.-TV didn't work.-Desk lamp didn't work.-No toilet paper on roll.-Dirty tub.-Sloppy paint on door  walls.-Coffee pot literally smelled of mold  had a distinguishable haze in corner (ie old coffee had never been washed out)-Heat didn't work (it was winter)-Very small  cramped room with queen bed squeezed in-Walls were so thin, we could hear BOTH conversations on each side of us, very clearly, and they were not talking loud.Staff:-Check-in staff shockingly unfriendly  cold-Concierge rude: we asked about places to eat, he said, I'll hook you up, then handed us one menu, then immediately started making loud, personal calls. We wanted other options, but we were tired  just wanted to eat something. When we were ready to order (from his buddy's take out place it appears), he handed us another phone handset while he still talked to his friend. We didn't even know who were were talking to on the phone.-Valet Parking was $24, so we asked the front desk about other options, they said ask the valet guys. So we did, and they didn't even want to talk to us.One night was too many.
Reviews.Author: sneddy

Reviews.Content: Awful service, stained towels As some people said, you don't go to New Orleans for the hotel room. Still, they service was terrible. They ran out of rooms with two double beds, which we already paid for, and did nothing to find a compromise for a switch the next day. They said, too bad. The staff was unfriendly and left us waiting at the check in counter several times for no apparent reason. The towels were stained and the carpeting sticky.On the plus side, the hotel is near the French Quarter. The area is a bit run down, but frankly, much of New Orleans is. The Ritz a few blocks down is still in a sketchy area. Nevertheless, I never felt unsafe, despite being there for Mardi Gras' madness. I recommend people pay the extra to stay in a Quarter BB or farther down the road.
Reviews.Author: wish71

Reviews.Content: Take Caution...Do Not Stay Here!! Seriously!       Stained Sheets
Reviews.Author: bb91507

Reviews.Content: smelly room omg this hotel sucks!!!!! when we checked in.. they ran out of double beds and my friends all had to share our beauty sleep on a bed.. they ran out of towels... our room smelled like dirty cat... all the hot water was gone by noon.... the employess have a bad attitude problem.... the hot dogs are expired.. the pizza is over rated.... !!!! a total bad experience!
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Really not that bad! Having read the previous reviews of this hotel, I was prepared for the worst, but thankfully the Park Plaza was nowhere as bad as expected! The location is perfect for reaching the French Quarter - about 10-15 minutes walk, although the streetcar also runs right past the hotel and taxis are easy to hail.  The rooms are large and clean with no major problems - the air conditioning did not work in our room but as it was January this was not a problem. My friends and I stayed in a total of 4 rooms, all of which were clean and recently refurbished, with no problems with damp as other reviewers have found. Most importantly, the rooms did not cost too much compared to a lot of the other large hotels in New Orleans. The rooms can be a bit noisy at times, but then it was a few days before Mardi Gras, with lots of college students staying.  The hotel staff were helpful but probably not as friendly as you might expect in a hotel of this type. Finally, the area immediately around the hotel is not particularly scenic and is potentially dangerous at night. We felt perfectly safe walking by day, however it's better to use taxis at night. Overall - well worth staying here, particularly for the price and proximity to the French Quarter.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: booking this hotel is a big mistake... This hotel was not acceptable to us. We booked this hotel on a different site that listed it as a 3 star hotel. That's a joke! When we walked in, the stench overwhelmed us. The staff members were unfriendly and not at all helpful. It is in a terrible part of town. It is not safe to walk near this hotel at night. The rooms are in disrepair. I felt a sense of being dirty until I was able to take a shower at my house upon returning, even though (of course) I showered several times at the hotel. I wouldn't reccommend this to my worst enemy.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Run do not walk away from this hotel My guess is that this place is no longer a Radison Hotel because it did not meet Radison standards. On check in we were told that we should upgrade our room for another $20.00 a day. The desk clerk said we would not be happy with the standard room. We viewed both rooms and said it was worth the $20.00 a day to have a room large enough to turn around in. Check in was slow, the restaurant was never open and the front desk was always rude. One night we were trapped in the elevator between floors. We rang the alarm for 5 mins and no help arrived. We then pried the doors open and freed ourselves. I reported it to the front desk and they did NOTHING. I stayed by the elevator to warn people not to get in it, after 25 mins I went to my room and the hotel had still not yet taken the broken elevator out of service. The next day I reported the problem to the hotel's acting manager and he told me they were sorry and went back in his office. I made a report with the hotel security people and they asked if we were the people that the fire department had to free. Looking like more people got trapped after we went to bed. Yes problems happen, but the hotel staff did not care or lift a finger to help or stop this from happening again.
Reviews.Author: Dandorth

Reviews.Content: Enough Already! I've been reading some posts on this site recently about various properties and, having stayed at the Raddison, nee Plaza, over Labor Day weekend, I am compelled to respond. First of all, I got an extremely good rate ($50s per night) a few months earlier. Thank God I didn't happen on this site before hand or I'm sure I would've cancelled. My room was on the top floor, overlooking the pool deck and Canal St and was immaculately clean, stocked with soap, shampoo, clean fresh plump towels, what you would expect. The decor and furnishing were fine and exactly as depicted on this site. When I first got to the room my key wouldn't open it, but fortunately the maid was there and let me in. I unpacked and called down to the desk and then just went down and got it replaced. That was the extent of my problems with the Hotel. Oh, I forgot that I had to go down a few floors to find a working ice machine. Tres` horrible!Two of the four morons staying in the next room managed to wake me up at 4AM every morning (finally I turned on CNN and blasted it loudly for an hour) but that's not the Hotel's fault. I could've asked to be moved probably...but didn't. Without exception all of the staff were gracious and cordial and extremely helpful, from maids (one gave me a tour of the empty Presidential Suite; it had been occupied earlier during my stay) to bellmen, doormen, wait staff, cashiers, front desk, etc. It was hot that time of year and the large pool deck is a perfect amenity...comfortable lounges and chairs and the pool was cool and a wonderful respite from sightseeing. I met some expatriate New Orleanians (attended culinary school) and they seemed perfectly content lounging beside the pool at the Raddison. The breakfast buffet was superb...fresh fruit and pastries, eggs, bacon, ham, sausage, grits, hash-browned potatoes  mouth-watering biscuits  sausage gravy. They bring you a large juice if you wish and a carafe of coffee. I feasted there every morning and never needed lunch. Oh, I forgot, one morning the scrambled eggs were cold. Maybe the sterno extinguished or, more likely, some moron didn't replace the cover on the serving dish. With all the other dishes it was hardly noticed. I think the brunch cost $13 minus tip. One night to avoid the restaurant mobs I ate in the Hotel. The Lobster bisque was rich and creamy and full of nice succulent chunks of white lobster meat. My NY steak was perfectly done medium-rare and surrounded (but not topped) with a Vin marchant sauce. Excellently prepared and served. For dessert I had coffee and 'Chocolate Decadence' -- devils food cake garnished with fresh strawberries  dripped sauce and fresh whipped cream. Do you think I'd remember its name if it weren鈥檛 as exquisite as it sounds?And lest anyone think it was a quiet Holiday weekend in town there was Southern Decadence in the FQ and a nation-wide Baptist convention occurring and the Hotel was full. I guess the elevators were a bit slow, perhaps that's to be expected of a property on the National Register of Historic Places. So unless the establishment has totally collapsed in the past 4 months it's a fine OLD Hotel, still catering to visitors after all these years.
Reviews.Author: Ramblin__Man

Reviews.Content: Traveler beware! Actually, we never got a chance to really stay here as they didn't have any rooms left when we arrived at 10:00pm after traveling for the better part of the day. And this after we had to prepay for the room due to a special event (Sugar Bowl) that we were there for. The only positive part about my experience with this hotel is that the lady behind the desk (after giving her some grief) credited our credit card half the cost (1 night, as we were staying 2 nights) and put us up in a suite at an AmeriSuites hotel that was located one block closer to the French Qtr. on Canal. The reason for the lack of rooms, according to them, was that they (Park Plaza) has a contract with Tulane Medical Center, which is located directly behind this hotel, to provide rooms for families of patients. They stated that some of these families did not check out when they were supposed to and, therefore, had a shortage of rooms. So, if you are thinking about using this hotel during busy times (Mardi Gras, Jazz Festival, etc), I would think twice.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Not as bad as everyone says. . . We, like everyone else giving a review, booked the room before we looked at this sight. And after reading the reviews, like everyone else, we got worried! However, we were pleasantly surprised and pleased with the hotel. We stayed there over the New Year's holiday and expected the hotel to be noisy--not the case! The hotel staff was extremely friendly despite how busy they were. Here's a tip--if you're nice to them, they're nice to you! The streetcar is really easy to catch--right out the front door! I would not cosider this hotel to be in a bad neighborhood--it's in the city--so it's not like a resort in the Carribean! The room was clean and well kept, although small. We enjoyed our stay and would go back again. Keep in mind, you're probably not paying a five star price, so don't expect a five star hotel!
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: The Good Side The price was certainly right - extremely cheap - for a room with a kingsize bed. Of course, the room was small and yes, the walls are thin. We were bothered by the slow elevators and the broken coke machine. The neighborhood is very bad, and it is a long way to the French Quarter but having the Canal Street streetcar just outside the door made getting around really easy. You can get a day pass and head for the French Quarter or with a transfer to the Garden District. If you can book a bargin room, this is okay for someone on a budget.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: One word - AWFUL We called ahead to ensure a double room and got a king. We reviewed the website before booking to ensure there was a free shuttle service and upon arrival was told there was none. Most of the equipment in the exercise facility was broken. The hot tub was the luke-warm tub.The room smelled awful, the bathroom was tiny, the bedding and furniture broken and/or dingy.The first night was noisy, then next night was so loud, we could not sleep and called security three times with no results. We left the next day. I left a small bag in the room and called one hour after leaving and somehow it went missing.All isses were addressed with the front desk and they were less than friendly. All in all, the worst experience I ever had with a hotel that apparently has a 3 star rating. I might expect this from a 1 star hotel, but not a Radisson.
Reviews.Author: gingtravel

Reviews.Content: Some good, some bad After reading the other reviews, I considered foresaking my prepaid Hotwire reservation and finding something elsewhere. We stayed 4 nights here in November and only had one bad night. It's true: the walls are paper-thin in this hotel. People on either side made too much noise and the next morning I asked for another room and was promptly given it. We had two quiet nights after that. The check-in was slow and not very welcoming: I've had warmer welcomes at a Wal-Mart. The walk between the hotel and Bourbon Str (8 blocks) is through a rough-neighborhood, but if you take the trolley outside the hotel, you can avoid the walk. I wouldn't stay here if I was paying a rack-rate, but for the $ we paid (57/night through Hotwire) it was as good as can be expected. A friend stayed at the Hyatt the same time as us and he said the noise was just as bad there.
Reviews.Author: FrequentflierUsa

Reviews.Content: it was alright The hotel had it's ups and downs.We go to New Orlean every year, We will stay in this hotel again. The room was not bad at all! The room and halls were clean, The staff was nice and helpful to us,The spa did work when we were there, It was on the quiet part of canal street. It did however take forever for the elevators and only 3 were working, We finally found a coke machine that worked on the pool deck, Be careful of the showers though the water would go from hot to cold then scolding in seconds for the whole shower. The hotel was by far better than the Ambassador that we stayed in the year before!!!
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: OK, not a mansion but not a dump either I first stayed here after winning a trip to NO at my job. I have since been back to the Radisson 4 times. The place has it's pros  cons, the elevator is slow, one floor does smell mildewy, the water was off once (but is was off for several blocks around the hotel too, city work), it could stand a little spit  polish. On the other hand the room was clean, the bed was comfortable, the A/C worked, the lobby was nice and the staff was very plesent. A street car will carry you the 3 or 4 blocks to the quarter. I walked it with my wife at night and although the area between is a little ruff looking I didn't feel threatened. To sum it up it is just an average hotel.
Reviews.Author: tooltimeterry

Reviews.Content: Run Fast In the Other Direction...Horrible! Just spent couple of nights at the Radisson. Be warned, this place is ABSOLUTELY terrible. Would not wish it on my worse enemy. Had a nightmares connecting to the Net from my room, maintenance showed up 3 hours later and had no clue what to do. Crumby cleaning sevice. Rude sullen incompetent staff and beware...they overcharge!!Had to raise queries about my bill and another guy came along doing the same thing. In a word...AVOID!!!!!!!!!!! They are meant to be changing their name soon...not sure to what, but I do understand why they would want to hide...Totally shambolic experience
Reviews.Author: Mona216

Reviews.Content: Only as a last resort We stayed here because the wedding reception was here. Paper thin walls. Painting on some floors and lots of construction noise all over. Moldy closet in one of our rooms. Food was nothing to write home about. Lobby was way too small to accommodate all the groups they were trying to check in and out. Not a great neighborhood and too far from French Quarter and Riverside activities, but at least the streetcar stop is right outside the hotel. Stay here only if you get a really good price and have no other options.
Reviews.Author: DilleauxL

Reviews.Content: The smallest room ever? Just returned from a stay at the Radisson, i must say it was the smallest room i have ever stayed in, the paint from the walls were peeling, the shower looked like a jr high school shower,the sink was loose from the wall,but that was the only way to lower the stool top, the room was very humid....gee im sure im forgetting something but im tired of typing. There are a few things that were ok.the lobby help was good(although they would not allow you to check in until 4) the elevators were not terribly slow. the walk although not far to me might still be unsafe for others. all and all i can honestly say i got my moneys worth since i didnt pay 2 much but for the people who paid more than 45 dollars u got jipped!
Reviews.Author: gwhite17

Reviews.Content: Don't Stay Here We had a reservation for 4 ppl to stay in one room and when we arrived they only had a king bed for us. I asked if they proposed that we all sleep in the same bed, and they said that they do not guarantee requests. They also said they might have to charge me for the night even though we didn't stay there. It's a far walk to Bourbon Street and in a not-so-nice neighborhood.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Lots of mold - 11/14/04 I just returned from my stay at the Radisson on 11/14/04. My room was very humid, had mold stains on the ceiling tiles, and had water stains down the walls. If you suffer from allergies, do NOT stay at this hotel. Also, the Radisson claims on its website that it鈥檚 鈥渏ust blocks from the French Quarter.鈥?It is NOT. In fact, it is seven blocks away from Bourbon Street, and getting to and from the Radisson from the FQ requires walking through a blighted section of Canal Street.
Reviews.Author: mauz1

Reviews.Content: Not too good I've stayed at this hotel twice. Big mistake. The room just wasn't as tidy as others in the area. The furnishings, carpet and bathrooms were well outdated. They do have a shuttle that runs to the French Quarter area, free, which is good. Don't try to walk to the quarter from this location alone. Even in the day was scary. I almost forgot about the incredibly slow elevators. I've stayed in Radissons elsewhere and LOVE them. This is the exception.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Yuck! Dirty, smelly, moldy--but staff was helpful We were staying at the Radisson for a conference. Boy, does it need a renovation! Paint peeling off the walls, hall carpet next to the ice machines so wet it splashes when you step on it, entire floors that stink of mold (and will really get your allergies going). The rooms are tiny and dirty, with barely enough room to walk around, and the walls are so thin that I was awakened all night by someone next door coughing *quietly*... and I was wearing earplugs!This is a real dump. It's like the Skid Row Experience (tm).We did find the staff helpful and sympathetic, but what a waste of money. We left a day early just to escape.Avoid this one!
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Not as bad as expected Perhaps I was expecting the worst from reading the reviews but it wasn't all that bad at the Radisson. We stayed there from Oct 30 - Nov 3 for a pool tournament. We had 11 people in our group staying in groups of 4, 3, 2 and 2. The group of 4 was able to get switched to a bigger room at no cost without even seeing the original room. The group of 3 switched rooms twice but were rewarded in the end with a much better room. The one couple had a room the size of a closet but they managed ok and my boyfriend and I upgraded to a suite for 22 more a night. Our room was clean and we had good housekeeping service (of course, I tipped each day). Check-in was really slow and service in the food section of the sports bar was awful but everyone else was pretty nice. The pool was really small and the spa had a layer of scum on the top. Personally, I wouldn't stay here again but it was convenient for the tournament and not that far from the French Quarter. Some of the people on the streets were pretty scary and watch out for the shoe-shine scam.
Reviews.Author: tkd

Reviews.Content: Not a dump but don't pay more than 50 bucks to stay We stayed here while attending a conference (so the room rates were WAY more than one would get through Priceline, etc.). Our room was okay -- large, but dirty and threadbare. The service was fine but the elevators! It took forever to move all of those people around -- take note, convention planners!The food was awful but most of our meals were taken off-premises, so this wasn't a huge issue.What did bother me was the condition of the crib they provided for my 10 month-old. I would not stay here again, even at a cheaper rate.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Lived up to the poor reviews A travel agent booked our group in this hotel on a recent business trip to New Orleans for a medical conference. The room was tiny (the smallest I have ever experienced nationwide). The carpet had huge black stains. The room lamp ate light bulbs and I had trouble getting the burned ones replaced.Room service forgot something everytime I ordered and I had to wait at least 45 minutes for the item they forgot. The maid took the towels and left me 4 hand towels and no bath towels. Although housekeeping promised to bring some, they never showed up. I had to ask for soap as there was none in the room. The restaurant serice was lousy and the bartender in the lounge, as well as the clerk that checked me into the hotel was rude. I have seen better Motel 6s ! I would not recommend this hotel to anyone. You have to shut the bathroom door to use the sink and then you have to be careful not to knock yourself out on the tiny ledge above the sink to brush your teeth. No counter in the bathroom, just a tiny ledge above the sink.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Yuck!! Dirty! I think Motel 6 would have been better following is a letter I sent to the corporate offices the day we got home from NO. October 19, 2004To Whom it May Concern;This past weekend we spent our first weekend in New Orleans. While reservations were made, we saw the Radisson name and automatically thought it was a reputable name. We looked up the hotel online through your website and saw pictures of beautiful rooms and amenities. We could not have been more disappointed when we arrived. First of all, we reserved a non-smoking room with a King bed. There were no non-smoking rooms available when we arrived so had to spend the first night in a smoking room, before moving to a non-smoking room for the following two days. The inconvenience of that alone was enough, but when we walked into a room barely big enough to fit the bed, that was beyond filthy, we were VERY upset. We asked if there were any suites in the hotel and we were told an emphatic NO! Both of the rooms we stayed in had black fuzzy mold growing from the AC vent and in the bath tub grout. Breathing that type of moldy air, with that allergies I suffer, put a huge damper on my weekend. The smell in both rooms was over powering. I even asked for clean sheets, blankets and comforter that did not seem to help. The bathroom sink hung over the toilet making for an uncomfortable 鈥渞elief鈥?time. The beds felt like springs covered with a cloth. Overall dusty, and dirty! We did make an effort to try to find another hotel, but seeing all the events in town, the nice hotels were all full. Our reservation was made through hotels and was also pre-paid, which would have made for a difficult recovery of our money. We feel you have inappropriately depicted your hotel on your website. You should show pictures of what people are really going to get. We spent almost 600.00 for a weekend in your hotel to have a horrible stay. To top it off, when we checked out, we were told that we couldn鈥檛 even collect our Gold Points, because our reservation was not made directly through Radisson. What a rip-off!
