We spent the money and should receive the points. We will NEVER stay at Radisson New Orleans again. We may even change our summer vacation in Lido Beach to another resort. That is how disappointed we are. I will also let you know that even the Taxi Cab drivers know what a dump your hotel is. He said he has heard it from EVERY person who has ever stayed there. I am a business owner, and if I knew this about my business, I would certainly jump into gear and fix the problem.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: it's better than you all think I stayed at this hotel last week. It was very full with convention of some sort and I was suprised that everyone with that convention that I saw was raving about the service and facilities. I was a little sceptical since I had read the reviews, but I was extremely and pleasantly suprised with my stay. I checked in on a Friday and had to wait about 10 minutes to check in but that is normal for New Orleans. I've stayed at the Sheraton there and it took almost an hour on a Friday before to check in. The staff was great and very attentive. My room was very nice believe it or not. It was larger than most with a couch, coffee table and recliner. I would definitely stay here again. Also, the breakfast buffet was the best I ever had.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Not so bad! After reading the reviews on here, I was somewhat hesitant about booking here, but I got a really good rate and decided to go for it. It was a perfectly fine hotel - reasonably clean, comfortable and convenient. The room was a little small, but adequate. Never saw any bugs and the sheets/towels were clean. The location is good - 15 minute walk to the French Quarter and the trolley stops directly outside the hotel. The walk to the French Quarter is not pretty, but not dangerous either. Overall, I would have no hesitation recommending this place, especially since they seem to offer a lot of good rates.
Reviews.Author: inkwave17

Reviews.Content: Pleasant stay We stayed September, 2004. The staff at this hotel are excellent and very helpful. My room was neat and clean for the most part and had most of the ammenities of the more expensive hotels. The beds were comfortable; however, we did have to request a sheet change on one bed as those on it were stained. The bathroom was clean except for a little mold in the tub grouting; the tub itself was clean. The room was a bit small, but really just fine since we spent most of our time out and about. The carpets could have been a little cleaner, but were not all that bad. We were on a nonsmoking floor so the halls smelled clean. The elevators were not slow, there was plenty of clean water, no cockroaches or ants, no mold except the little bit mentioned above. There was one spot of water damage to a wall in the hall. The rest was fine. The pool and jacuzzi were in operation and clean with a nice rooftop view. The location was fine for us; we did not feel unsafe and we walked or took the trolly everywhere. The trolly practically stops at the door (about a half block away). You can get a Visatour pass for three days which avoids the hassle of exact change and is reasonable. The breakfast we ate once in Pralines left us wanting something better and since there is better available, I wouldn't waste my time. There is a little stress on the building furniture here and there. We had a good stay for a very good value and I would recommend it if you don't mind a little wear here and there, mostly minor.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Well duh! it's New Orleans If you are going to New Orleans for the hotel room, don't go here. But... it is inexpensive, clean enough, and we found the staff to be as helpful and friendly as in any busy hotel. (you're not there to make lifelong friends with them anyway.) No it is not in an upscale area, but it is only a 15 minute walk to the French Quarter, which we (two fifty something ladies) managed quite nicely, late at night or anytime for that matter with absolutely no hassles or problems. People should remember to keep their wits about them ANYWHERE they are traveling. Yes the walls are paper-thin, and yes there is an odd smell near the elevators but they have a lovely roof top pool, great big cheap drinks at happy hour, clean, if not luxurious rooms and for $42 bucks a night, frankly we got what we paid for. Would we stay there again? Yes.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Radisson at the right price is 'worthy' Stayed for the second time this year (2004 ) at this hotel, scored room on PRiceline (double OR single ) for $38 per night--a major coup in this town for decent 3*s at ANY Time of the year! Hotel is truly decent (DON'T pay attention to the reviewers who rated this place a dump--it's NOT). Service is a bit slow but it is a busy city hotel. Rooms were a decent size (king or two doubles), clean, nice furnishings, location is a few blocks outside the quarter (in a borderline questionable neighborhood --but I never had any problems). Pool and deck area were lovely. If driving, don't park in the hotel garage for $20 per day--one-two short blocks away (around the corner) are self-park options for $5.
Reviews.Author: rmwhitt

Reviews.Content: Warning - Don't book a Radisson Hotel The service at this hotel is absolutely terrible - I would never ever stay at a Radisson and reading reviews of other Radissons in other locations confirms that it is a chain wide problem We had a reservation in October 2004. We arrived early around 1:30 pm and were advised that check in was 3. Our reservation was confirmed. The luggage check was packed with luggage and there was huge line up so we decided to sit in the bar until 3 pm. We arrived back at 3 pm to another huge line up - right out the door. THe lobby was absolute chaos!!! It took us at least an hour to get through the check out to find out they had overbooked the hotel and were bumping us out - we finally arrived at another hotel around 5:30 pm. A loss of 4 hours of our weekend in New Orleans - a big loss when travelling all the way from Canada!!! The manager could care less - was very ignorant. The only nice person was the lady at the front desk - she admitted that the situation was unacceptable - it was her first night on the job. I wrote letters to head office and the hotel itself - and didn't receive any reply.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: They tried but couldn't quite make it.... We booked this hotel on Expedia. After booking, I read the reviews and was very nervous about staying there. One of the former posts mentioned a name of the staff Eugene stating that he was exceptional in his treatment of guests. I called him w/my concerns and he assured me that he would pre-assign a renovated room. The room was large, clean enough - small bathroom, no full length mirror. We were to stay Friday, 8/20 till Monday, 8/23. We arrived late Friday night - this hotel is not in the best of neighborhoods but we did ok walking to and from the Quarter - a little scary though - lots of people sleeping on the street - drunk or just no where else to go. Saturday night when we got home from the Quarter, I walked into the bathroom only to see a cockroach - we killed it! On Sunday afternoon, we were sitting in the living rm area and lo and behold - another cockroach - killed that one too - I walked over to the closet area and there was another one. Well, even though we were visiting swamp land, I did not wish to share my room with bugs. Called Eugene at the front desk and he assisted us w/finding a different hotel - took care of the extra nights stay and was extremely understanding and courteous. That man was EXCEPTIONAL! If bugs don't bother you, this hotel was good for the money. Staff was extremely courteous and helpful. It is an old building - in need of much renovation (some has been done). If the bugs had not been visible, I would have stayed the entire trip.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Well..it is New Orleans We stayed in early august 2004. We were there for 4 days.. aside from being somewhat inconvienent to the Quarter, and the total lack of hotel food that would have been nice late at night when we didn't want to leave the hotel for one reason or another, ( who eats at the hotel in New Orleans, anyway?)I didn't have any issues with the hotel. I found the staff to be curteous, and housekeeping appropriately decourous. The dearth of soda machines was hard to take- but once again, it is New Orleans...put that soda down and grab a beer. New Orleans is not a cheap town and the hotel provided value if not a conveneint location..BTW- the Quarter can be reached by streetcar in about 5 minutes. Walking, I got there in about the same amount of time, walking briskly..
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Renovated when? This is a dreadful hotel and a real disappointment as it was represented to be a newly renovated, three-star hotel. We encountered a smelly (think mold), dark, cramped room; a murky, cloudy swimming pool; broken exercise equipment; dripping ice machines with bath towels laid underneath; walls with primer applied waiting to be painted, just to name a few unpleasantries. On top of this, it's in a questionable section of town and a hike to the French Quarter. Don't waste your money and ruin your vacation by staying here. We checked out after one night.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Less than zero, a hole in the wall, worse than a port-o-let The place is a scumhole plain and simple. It has paper thin walls, dirty everything- a real dump. If you complain, they just shuffle you from room to room, without bothering to change the sheets. The whole place smells like a toilet. We moved three times. I thought Radisson's were a cut above the others, but I will never stay at any Radisson again. Those people who say positive things either work for the hotel or live in a gutter if they think this hole is acceptable in any way at all. The only nice thing is the lobby which is always crowded with people trying to get moved out of their crappy, broken down room. I have stayed in many hotels, this is BY FAR THE WORST. Run, don't walk, away from this place!!!
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Great hotel for the money. Not a bad hotel at all; far from the very negative comments I have read here. The baby boomers can appreciate this place as it is an old grand hotel from days gone by. Nothing here for teeny boppers..... but a nice place to visit New Orleans from. Staff helpful and kind; location is perfect as far as the French Quarter is concerned. Street car in front of hotel makes travel easy. My girlfriend and another couple were pleased and we plan to return before year's end. May even take my office staff to NO for their Xmas party. All the complaints are certainly not warranted; have traveled extensively and see nothing wrong with this hotel. Not a resort facility but a convenient and economical choice for those who want to see NO.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Not bad for the price While not the greatest hotel in the world, we were able to stay here for about 67.00 with tax, etc which I though was reasonable for what we got. The room was clean - older, but sufficiently clean and actually quiter than the other nicer hotels we have stayed at in NO. Bed was comfortable and bathroom although small, was clean. We were upset to learn they ended their free shuttle service on 7/15, but found riding the canal street trolley (1.25 each way) to be safe and easy. If you do walk, I recommend walking in the middle of the street where the trolley runs. Bad points - funky smell on the 3rd floor the whole time we were there- luckily it was just in the hallway and not our rooms. didn't notice this smell on other floors. Definitely NOT a luxury hotel - but fine if you can get it for a good price and want to see NO on a budget.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Never again Stayed here in October 2003. Checked in late but advised them prior that it would be a late arrival.Turned up and found that they had High School Bands and they had sold our room. So we were bumped to a Best Western 10 minutes away. Checked in Next morning, 1st room had water coming through the lights and was buzzing !!. 2nd Room offered was dark and dingy but the hotel was fairly full. Kept awake every night with parties in rooms either side. Restuarant took ages for food. Not a particulary nice location eitherStay in the Quarter next time I hear my wife scream over the noise from next door. !!
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Stay away from the Rad. The gutter is cleaner. I see the Radisson hasn't changed since I went there in Jan. 2001. The first room they put us in was covered with mold, the wallpaper was coming down. The bar closed early and there was no place to get a cup of coffee in the evening. Stay away. Stay down at the French Quarter.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: The Big Dump! This was the dirtiest hotel ever. Upon arriving to our room we discovered our sheets were soiled!The bathroom was dirty-hairs(not mine) on the bathroom floor. I complained to the manager but he didn't seem to care.It was also very noisey. I could hear everything in the next hotel room(every word of every conversation). They worst part is the Radisson sent me a survey asking for feedback(they said they'd respond back to me in 2-3 days) and I never received a response back. TERRIBLE customer service.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Never again Ok, first of all the good points..Staff pretty good..Room was a renovated one..clean but smallThe Causey Shuttle to french quarter was thebest feature..Pool not bad....Now why I say Never AgainLocation just not very good...sort of scary...Exterior of motel other than lobby very dirty....only had 2 elevators working out of 4..with over 700 rooms stairs were often taken..stairways very filthy..motel hallways also dirtyas reported earlier here hot tub out of order..restaurants were closed half the time..it was really good for the price but really in July the rates at the 5 star hotels are not much higher..Raddison..your franchise is going down if you permit this on your inspections..
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: This Hotel IS A Dump! What a dump! The lobby is attractive. However, I knew I was in trouble when I got on the elevators. There is carpeting on the elevators walls. The hallways to the rooms are dark and dingy. My first room was small. The bed comforter and the bathroom shade were torn. The bathroom ceiling had flaking paint from moisture build up. I complained and was upgraded to a junior suite. This room was better, but the carpet was stained. Renovations in the bathroom had been half-completed; there was plaster in the bathtub and holes in the wall. The entire hotel needs renovating. The front desk staff was helpful. I won't be staying at the Radisson New Orleans again and recommend that travelers stay away from this hotel.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: I won't be back I have stayed at many hotels for a much cheaper price with much better environments. You walk in thinking this hotel is going to be great until you exit the elevator onto your floor. The rooms are small (all are in New Orleans) and unkept. I found trash on the floor (a lighter, fast food cup, used matches, and cigarette wrapers). The hot tub, which the hotel is so proud to advertise, was broken. The ice machine didn't work. The box springs on one of my beds was protruding a spring which I cut my leg on. My room was never serviced even though I was gone from the room for more than 5 hours during the day. We had no clean towels or wash cloths. No coffee for the morning. And our trash cans were spilling on to the floor (I could only push it down so far). The real kicker was the morning I was checking out only 1 of 4 elevators were working. It took me 30 minutes just to catch the one elevator. When I mentioned our problems, everyone just said I'm sorry but there was no action taken. This definitely not what I expected from a Radisson Hotel.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Not great~Not bad~somewhere in-between Just spent the last Friday night at the Radisson. Booked two rooms. One for 3 teens and the other for my husband and myself. It was not as bad as the reviews are saying.The valet service was fine albeit pricey ($27.00).The rooms were small but our bed was comfortable and linens were clean. The bathroom was very clean and water pressure was great--plenty of hot water.There was a long wait at the elevator (it appeared that one 2 of the 4 were working this past weekend). Had we not be on the 12th floor-we would have taken the stairs.Rooms were a little noisy as we heard our neighbors talking when then arrivee around 3AM--toilets flushing etcAll in all--not bad. I think we paid $75.00/room and booked via the internet.
Reviews.Author: lauriebyoga

Reviews.Content: Run (in another direction) Run somewhere else, no matter the cost, unless you enjoy a cramped, smelly, moldy, dim, miserable hotel room. Yes, this is an 'historic' property but the dirt build up behind the toilet, corners and along the baseboard weren't that old. The mattress was no relief since you could feel the springs because of a lack of padding on it. Our AC ran loudly and constantly but never cooled or took the humidity out of the room-the air was very stale and miserable. We asked for it to be repaired for 2 days and no one showed up. They were out of shampoo and lotion the whole time we were there, even though twice housekeeping said they'd bring it right up. The parking is $25 a day and the valet  bell hops help with the doors ONLY when you are paying. They do have a free bus that provides FREE service to the French Qtr  Riverwalk.
Reviews.Author: annie49

Reviews.Content: Filthy,Crowded, I've stayed in many NOL hotels, and this was the WORST. It was absolutely filty in the halls  the rooms, the air was broken, carpet disgusting, mold everywhere. The staff was worthless. The line for the lobby elevators often lasted 30 minutes. Worst was parking. It took almost 2 hours to check out and get our car! The only positive was after much arguing with their corporate office, I finally got a complete refund.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Radisson: Just as Bad as the Stench on Bourbon My boyfriend and I stayed at this hotel from 6/3/04 through 6/8/04; the service, location, and rooms were abysmal. This would not be as irritating if the room was not $300 per night due to a conference in town. Paying more that $45 per night for this dump is ludicrous. Unfortunately there were 36,000 other meeting-attendees taking most of the rooms in the city so the nearest rooms were 18 miles away from the conference center.We checked into the room, which was reputed to be a queen. It was definitely a double/full, however when I called to state the room was not as expected I was informed it's a standard queen, in a rude tone. Although definitely not the case, we let it drop as the only other available rooms were behind the elevator shaft and very noisy. When we finally laid down on the bed (in a room that was approximately 12 feet by 14 feet) there were spring sticking up all over the mattress.There was a hair brush on the floor at the edge of the bed. You can hear every flush of every toilet above, below, and beside your room.The pool had dirty towels in the bottom, the hottub was out of service.When calling for a wakeup call I was placed on hold for more than five minutes. Much of the staff is rude, abrupt, or unknowledgeable. On the plus side Gail in guest services was very helpful.All in all, I would recommend against any friend staying at this location.
Reviews.Author: kjhharris

Reviews.Content: Not as bad as all that I booked this hotel for three nights starting 5/20/04. It was at least 30% cheaper than any other decent looking hotel with good access to the quarter and downtown. It was a Radisson so I figured everything would be fine -- then I read these reviews. They made me nervous, but it was booked and paid for. I didn't experience any of the horrorshows decribed by some others. The room was nice, clean, made up daily. No, the closet wasn't huge. It was fine though. Bathroom fine and the water was hot  plentiful. Room  hallways smelled fine. The elevators were a liitle slow during peak hours, but I never had to wait more than three or four minutes. It is a big hotel though, so they should make sure all four elevators are working (only three were when I was there). Overall the service was good. The sports bar they have there is a dump, but in a city with the gretaest bars in the world, you're not going to hang out at the hotel sports bar. The location is good accessability-wise. It is a somewhat grim stretch of Canal street but an easy 10 minute walk to the quarter. I never bothered with the shuttle bus they provide. For $80/night on an Expedia deal I thought it was a good deal.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: You get what you pay for First of all, if like me you booked this hotel before reading these reviews: don't panic. It's not as bad as you fear, and considering most people are paying very low rates to stay here, they shouldn't expect a five-star hotel.I stayed at the Radisson for a weekend in May '04. The rooms aren't huge, but everything in mine was clean, quiet and in working order. I will say that the staff weren't the friendliest, but who ever goes on holiday to make lifelong friends with the hotel receptionist?The location isn't that bad. It's a bleak street in that you have to walk ten minutes to get anywhere of interest (i.e. the French Quarter), and sure, you may pass one or two homeless people. But I didn't feel any more threatened walking it at night than I have in any other major US city. Which is not a lot. And you can always take taxis back to the hotel if that's a concern.I had no problems getting to sleep both nights, and the room was always cleaned promptly.Don't book a reservation here if you're the type who wants to spend their entire time away from home sitting on the bed, watching free HBO and admiring the view from your window. This is an affordable, adequate location for people on limited budgets and reasonable expectations.
Reviews.Author: washdctravel

Reviews.Content: Radisson was quite ok I was a bit surprised at the very negative reviews of the Radisson. Though I agree that the rooms are very small, I did not have any problems at all with the room not being clean or any noise from adjacent rooms. I was pleasantly surprised with the comfort of the room and the staff at the front desk and in the Pralines restaurant were very friendly. The bathroom was a bit tight and the remote control did stop working at one point but overall I was pleased with the stay. I booked through Expedia and paid an average of $86/night. The actual price per night varied between $71-116 over my total 9 nights stay. The price was fair based on the relatively convenient location. Overall, I would stay here again.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Grim and Rundown, with a depressing location This was the most rundown hotel I've ever stayed at. We were there for a conference, and by the end of the stay, the customer service rep was out of business cards: everyone had complained--of smelly rooms, broken furniture, abysmal service, malfunctioning elevators. In our room, the rug has been ripped out of the closet and other corners of the room, leaving bare concrete beneath. Adding insult to injury is the location of this poorly-maintained hotel: It's not located where most hotels are. It's on a rundown, busy stretch of a street and you have to walk a long distance or take a cab to get to where the smarter tourists are staying--where the restaurants are, where the heart of the city is.We never receivved a repy to our formal letter of complaint by the way.
Reviews.Author: janeyre

Reviews.Content: No extra charge for the Mold at least As Bill the Cat once said AAAACK! This hotel was grisly, cramped and not what I expected from a member of the Radisson chain. Our 1st room was on a non-smoking floor but had obviously been the site of a cigar party earlier. Our second room was better but smaller than most hotel rooms in Hong Kong! There was mold on the inside of the shower curtain, the sink was almost coming off the wall and the towels were as cheap as possible. There was so little room around the bed that we walked over it and the noise from the Jazz fest guests was quite a challenge. Luckily enough we had a nice BB to stay at after our 1 night at the Ratisson so our stay in New Orleans got much better!
Reviews.Author: iGuy

Reviews.Content: WORKED OUT FINE We stayed at this hotel for 10 nights starting 3/24/04. I booked this hotel using Hotwire. Great deal @ $53 night being that it was so close to the French Quarter. After booking hotel, I read many, many negative reviews to the point that I was afraid to stay there. I called the hotel itself and voiced my concerns. When we arrived, we were given a renovated room. Very, very nice. We had a positively fabulous time. Yes, there were some negatives - the room was small, closet was 6 inches deep, elevators were slow, pool not open. This is a historic hotel and rooms were smaller then and elevators were slower. The pool was supposed to be open by mid-march but the pool company was on 'NAWLINS time! The positives were that the room was kept spotless by the maids - the shuttle bus to the french quarter was a wonderful surprise - the BEST postive of all were the hotel employees - all of them from the doormen to the maids - were the NICEST PEOPLE we have ever, ever encountered anywhere in the U.S. or europe!
Reviews.Author: Pstep13

Reviews.Content: Not a 'FlopHouse' My 3 friends and I booked 2 rooms at the Radisson for the second weekend of Jazzfest (4/29- 5/2) on Hotwire for $55 per night. At the time we made our reservation, other hotels in the CBD or quarter were $160 and up. Like everyone else who has posted on this website, I was very concerned with the negative comments I was reading as our trip approached. In fact, I even called a friend in N.O. to see if we could use his apartment in case the hotel was a dump. Well, I am happy to report that our stay exceeded all my expectations. The room was clean and appeared to have been renovated within the last few years. The Lobby was nice. The staff was extremely friendly. My wait time to check in was about 10 minutes. The only problems we encountered were a slow drain in the tub and slow elevator service. It seemed to me that of the 4 elevators only 2 were working most of the time. The hotel's location isn't the greatest, but I never felt unsafe. There were a few panhandlers, but that was about it. If you don't want to walk, you can take the new Canal Street street car that stops right in front of the hotel, or you can take a cab. The doormen were always happy to flag down a cab for us. The walls are paper thin, but noise was never a problem. I did talk to a group that a had a problem with mold in their room, but the hotel was able to move them to another room.In conclusion, I feel like we got an amazing bargain for a hotel so close to the quarter during Jazzfest. I wouldn't pay their regular rates to stay there, and I probably wouldn't stay there with my wife, but if you can get a price like we did utilizing Priceline or Hotwire, and can put up with minor inconvienences, go for it, you will not be disappointed.
Reviews.Author: ejlindah

Reviews.Content: Don't be scared by reviews For my recent trip (April 16-19) I purchased a room through Hotwire for $54/night. When it was first revealed that my room was at the Radisson, I wasn't thrilled... it's not on the good/tourist end of Canal. After reading these reviews I was terrified of what I had gotten myself into. My fears were unfounded. I arrived at the hotel at 2PM on Friday and was immediately able to check in to my room. Yes, the rooms are smaller than those in newer buildings, but this is a landmark hotel... accomodations just weren't as spacious back in the 1920s. The furnishings do need an update (especially the well-worn carpeting), but everything was clean when I arrived and my room was attended to every day while I was out. The rooftop pool had just opened for the season when I arrived . The pool was clean (but cold) and towels were available for guests at poolside. The staff was friendly. I was even able to arrange for a late/1PM checkout. I expereinced no problems with the water during my stay.My complaints... The elevators are very slow. Very. I didn't get the king I had requested. And the parking options do leave much to be desired. We were able to find parking on the street; however, weren't entirely comfortable with the situation. But it was better than the $20+ daily valet rate the hotel charges. And we had no problems with the car being out there. Just remember to fill the meters... or leave the car at home and use the hotel shuttle or the Canal Street Streetcar.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Better than expected... I did read all the bad reviews after I booked my hotel through hotwire and was so worried that the hotel was going to be a really bad experience. And of course you can't cancel or get your money back when you book through hotwire, but I did get a really good deal. All in all for the money $55 per night it was great! The hotel was nicer than I expected, since I expected the worst after reading the reviews. I asked for a renovated room and had to wait an hour and 1/2 but it was worth it. My room was clean and quite pleasant. Although at night the light came in pretty bright around the door to the room (some weather stripping could fix that problem). I think it was a pretty far walk to the quarter but the shuttle bus was a great alternative. As far as parking don't use the valet service - park accross the street on the side of the hotel on LaSalle Street - $6.50 a day (inside garage) safe, close, and cheap! We had a great time in New Orleans and enjoyed the hotel as well. I guess we got lucky.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Wasn't the Ritz but wasn't the pits. I stayed here for 4 nights (4/16 through 4/20) through Priceline. It was listed as a 3* and I paid $40 per night. I would rate it more like a 2* and would never pay full price for it (Expedia was charging an average of $135 per night.Although check-in is officially 4pm, they let us check in at 12:30pm. However, only a full size bed was available. We stayed on the 4th floor. The room was pretty small and old looking, but it was generally clean and the maids were friendly. We hung the SHH sign on the door all 3 days and weren't bothered by housekeeping. However, on the last night there the neighbors were pretty loud (the walls are indeed paper thin). You have to drown out the rude people who talk on the phone at 4am by using the air conditioning (which works well).The location is about a 10 minute walk to the French Quarter. Upon first review it seems you have to walk through bad neighborhoods to get to the French Quarter, but we never had any problems, even at night. They do run a free shuttle once an hour which we took several times. It was convenient and the driver was very friendly (as like most people down there). It makes a stop at Harrah's and in the French Quarter. However, if you miss it, it's not a bad walk back. They just started running the street car up Canal Street so you can take that for $1.25. And, if you want to walk back instead, I would suggest walking up along the tracks of the street car (which runs up in the middle of the street and provides plenty of space to walk). No one bothers you there and plenty of people use the tracks to walk up.I tried to check out by using the tv, but it was too slow, so I went downstairs to check out. They do charge you a $2 tourist fee per night which each hotel charges. It's not included in your Priceline Taxes. However, for $40 per night, an extra $2 tax is not a big deal.The pool was a bit small and I didn't end up using it. We just lounged by the pool. Most of the time the elevators were fine, but one day a huge group was checking in and the lobby was wall to wall people. We had to use the stairs because the lines were crazy. Others higher up were using the service elevator. We didn't use the hotel restaurant or room service because the French Quarter has so many good restaurants.Finally, this hotel is about 3 blocks from the city bus line which runs to and from the airport. Because we didn't have a lot of luggage we opted to use that, which was $1.60 each way. At the airport, it comes about every 25 minutes and is the E-2 Airport Express. You pick it up outside door 7. Going to the airport, you pick it up on Tulane Ave. across from the library. There's really no reason to rent a car unless you want to drive outside New Orleans.
Reviews.Author: gtinct

Reviews.Content: Worst hotel in 30 years All the other reviews here tell it all. This is the worst hotel I have stayed in over 30 years of travel. The worst thing is that many years ago when it was the Clarion it was a nice place. They have allowed it to get so run down it belongs on the one-star hotel list and does not deserve the name Radisson on the front door.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: You can't have it all... The price was right and the location was good so we booked it. The free shuttle to the river and the French Quarter was probably the best thing about staying at this hotel. The hotel itself was nice, the maid service was good but the walls are PAPER thin. Dh commented that if our neighbors didn't turn out their lights, we couldn't get to sleep! Darned uncomfortable beds, too.All in all, I wouldn't cross it off my list, but I'll probably try another hotel next time.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Pleasantly Surprised After reading the previous reviews I was a bit apprehensive about this hotel. However on reaching the hotel i was pleasantly surprised by the helpful front desk. I requested a king bed in a non smoking room and they adjusted me with no problems and also said that if i had any problems with the room they would give me another one. The hotel is located 10 min from Bourbon street and has a free shuttle with stops at the casino and one right next to Cafe Du monte on Decatur street. One suggestion is to park in the parking behind the hotel by paying $5 a day and to avoid the expensive hotel valet parking charging $25 for a day. The parking lot is right behind the hotel and can be reached by taking the Le Salle Street. The rooms are a bit small and the tub was not very clean but other then that I think i got a steal for the price I paid.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: What Do You Expect for a Bargain? We were also very concerned about our stay at the Radisson after reading the reviews. We book through Hotmail, knew we were stuck and hoped for the best. Our room was small but it was clean - what I was most worried about. It was a 15 min walk to Bourbon but we enjoyed it and had no problems. The staff especially the doormen and concierge were very helpful and polite. There was no pool, hot tub, or piano bar that was ever open. While we would not choose to stay here again for 55 dollars it was great!
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: At a loss for words Are these rooms really 3-star as is suggested? Not the 3 rooms I had the unfortuante opportunity to tour. Upon check-in I was told my room may not be clean yet, this at 6:30 pm...then I found out why after 3 trips to the front desk. The battery in the key accpetor was out of juice, and the housekeepers did not think to use a master key to get in to clean it. The next room has a black tar-like stain on the floor and the third, and final room had a dirtier bathroom than my college days.From this trip on, I will never try to go cheap again in New Orleans.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: A Nightmare!! Arrived on time, waited in line for an hour to check in. Waited another hour for a room to come open. Finally, took a smaller room just to get some sleep. Because we booked through the internet, they said they couldn't refund any money!! Dirty, no good place to eat, very unprofessional staff behavior.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: The Friendly Radisson On March 12, 2004, I stayed at the Radisson with my daughter and her 4 rooomates from college. I had read reviews on this site and we were wondering what we had gotten into. Where I can agree that you can hear loud noises if they are occuring in adjoining rooms, I can't agree with anything else. Although we arrived at this hotel at 11am we were given keys to our rooms. We found them to be comfortable and clean. The concierge desk was very attentive to our needs, arranging shuttle service to the airport for 2 of the girls. They also told us about the hotel's shuttle to the French Quarter and marked on a map where pick up was and at what time. During the day the walk (9 blocks to Bourbon) was OK, but I probably wouldn't advise it at midnight. The hotel's shuttle runs until midnight. It was good advise from a user of this site, to park in the public garage right around the corner from the hotel. This cost $13.00 for the 2 days we were in New Orleans. The shuttle driver was very helpful in pointing out attractions in the French Quarter. During the 2nd day of our stay I had a great Oyster Po' Boy from the hotel's snack and deli service. I had told the girls with me that I had read either totally good reviews on this site or totally bad (i.e. a dump) I promised them I would write a review stating that this was a very good, full of friendly staff experience for us.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Dirty Rooms, No Water! The reviews of this hotel are correct - not very good. We stayed at this hotel Feb 13/14. Upon check in, we were given a dirty room! We weren't the only guests given unclean rooms either. Then the water for the entire hotel broke. The water was off for almost 12 hours! The rooms are small and you can hear your neighbors conversations. The manager was very nice though very stressed due to all of the problems. I'd recommend that you stay somewhere else.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Hotel from Hell Working in the hotel industry myself I understand that there are problems in hotels however this is the worst hotel I have ever stayed at. There was not ANY water for half of our trip! I called the Front Desk and asked what I should do if I have to go to the bathroom and she told me that I couldn't go to the bathroom and she was sorry that she didn't know what to tell me! We had the standard room for 160/night which was outrageous because we had to basically crawl over the 2nd bed during our trip to get to the bathroom. It's the smallest room I have ever seen. Very depressing too. The bathroom has no counter space hardly, the tub was dirty, the lights didn't work, the remote didn't work, the TV was unplugged, The Staff was rude (except Eugene), There are not any candy/snack machines at all and the gift shop closes at 10pm, the parking is 30/day unless you want to park in the next door parking deck which is 7 dollars a day HOWEVER you cannot get your car out or in between the hours of 10pm-6am... so we had to pay for a taxi the whole time or walk. Hotel is located in front of parade route which is nice but streets are blocked. They tried to charge us tax twice of 15 dollars a person... Line is always long at Front Desk and the Operator rarely answers. Called for towels and had to go on the floor to find a maid since one never came to our room. Walls are paper thin so if someone is fighting or having other activities it's very loud. The elevators are slow. I think everything else would have been fine except for no water, we couldn't take a shower or use the bathroom. The hotel did not offer any water.Whatever you do, stay somewhere else!!
Reviews.Author: Brandi777

Reviews.Content: Surprising good experience! We booked our room for the Sugar Bowl (1/2-1/5)before reading the reviews and expected the worst. However, we were very pleased. Clean, comfortable room, good maid service, all staff helpful. A problem with the elevators one day, but pretty minor. The free shuttle was convenient to get to and from the Frence Quarter, and we were only 4 blocks from the Superdome. Surprisingly enough, a great experience compared with many other reviews on this site!
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Terrible! I visited the Radisson during a conference the last week in January. The place was an absolute dump! The staff was also very unfriendly! I asked for a cab at the valet desk and the person wouldn't even budge a foot until I showed him some money. The rooms were dirty and for my entire stay I had no hot water. The conference rooms were either terribly hot or extremely cold depending on the day. This hotel is definitely one to stay away from if one ever goes to New Orleans!
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: No Water!! I spent two nights here and was satisfied with the hotel until the day of my departure. I woke up around 6 in the morning and was going to take a shower when the water had completely stopped in the entire hotel. When I went downstairs to ask for another room, I was told that there was no water in the entire hotel and that they didn't know when the water woudl be fixed. So there was no toilet water or anything, even in the lobby. I heard a few people asking for the manager but the manager was taking the day off. Otherwise, the hotel was decent. THe rooms are pretty clean, you can hear conversations of your next door neighbors, and the rooms are pretty small, but other than that, the hotel was stayable. I would just wait until they are fully renovated before going there.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Don't believe all those horror stories you see in the reviews..... ...... I recommend this property! I had purchased my room on one of those internet sites where you don't know the property until after you buy it. After I read the posted reviews, I was at least to say VERY concerned. However, considering the rate I got and the scarcity of rooms in New Orleans during the Sugar Bowl, I thought we would stick it out (besides it was already charged to my credit card) We got there in the morning and were allowed to check in right away. We got a standard King room, which was a little on the small side, but was well furnished, very clean and in good repair. This is an older hotel property, so smaller rooms are to be expected. Besides we didn't come to NO to sit in the hotel room. The staff was friendly and helpful. Despite the outcome of the game, our stay was nice. Maybe those other problems do exist, but we did not experience anything negative at all. Considering it was during one of the most busy times, I was pretty surprised. The location at the end of Ccanal street is not in the middle of the action, but a few short blocks away from public transportation, but I understand that a Canal streetcar line will start to service the hotel sometime this year. I do recommend using the parking garage around the corner (much less than the hotel valet parking) I will stay here again....absolutely!
Reviews.Author: andhow

Reviews.Content: You people just like to bitch Ok, after I reserved a room here for 2 nights I read these reviews. I was scared to death...even thought about changing my hotel plans. But I got a heck of a deal on the room and decided to take my chances.Obviously this place is not going to be the Ritz...I got the room for $54 a night! But I was pleasantly surprised with the hotel as a whole. The room was clean and the cleaning staff was there every day doing their duties (some days too early!). The elevators worked pretty well. They were sometimes slower when it was a busy time but as a whole I had no trouble getting to and from my room.The only complaint I have is the whole parking situation, which is pretty usual for New Orleans. We were pretty much forced to pay for valet parking ($28 a night) which to me is more typical of New Orleans locals trying to screw a tourist than it being specific for this hotel. The people who are saying this is the worst hotel they have ever stayed at obviously have nothing better to do or I was just lucky enough to get the one great room in the whole place.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Nightmare in New Orleans Fresh body fluids on the pillows, sheets not changed, ragged towels suitable to mop the floor, bed like a hamper, elevators don't work, smelly, moldy, noisy, rude people (especially Casear at the front desk) avoid it like the plague, even if it is free or if they paid you, it is better to be sleep on the sidewalk.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Why do you think this hotel is cheaper than the other major chains? This hotel is unscenically located many blocks from the French Quarter next to I10 and a large parking garage. The place is dowdy and rundown, a characteristic shared by many hotels in New Orleans, but not exactly what one expects from a major chain. I found the room to be well cleaned but horribly run down with cracks in the toilet, cracks in the bathtub (luckily no crack dealers nearby) and the room ventilation system sounded like a vacuum cleaner on steroids. The latter had to be tunred off if you decided you needed to sleep. The front desk people are friendly enough if of minimal competence, and forget about trying to use the TV checkout as you;ll have to wait 20-30 minutes anyway at the front desk to get your receipt, which they said would sent to my home and wasn't.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Great Staff, Great Food, Great Value I was in New Orleans on pleasure with my family of 4 and did not want to miss out on any attractions because of really overpriced hotels. I had not reviewed this hotel online or I might not have booked my room here, but our stay turned out to be very good. Our room was spacious and clean. The hotel restaurant was very accessible and inexpensive to feed a family of four without taking money away from our dinner and entertainment funds. We were able to go to great restaurants in the city for dinner because we did not have to pay inthe $180's-$200's for a room we would not even be in all day. Their FREE shuttle got us into the heart of the city and back to the hotel without a problem at all. I'd recommend this hotel for families and reunions of any type. The hotel staff was very kind and took good care of us the entire time. Thanks New Orleans Radisson for a great time.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Bad, Very Bad I spent 4 miserable days here in Dec. 2003. While waiting in line to check in, I overhead people talking about the hotel not having water for the past 2 days. Upon my check-in, nothing was mentioned about a water problem. When I entered my room, I went to use the bathroom and found the toilet full of someone else's waste. The room had no running water at all. When I called to complain, I was told we're sorry, they are working on it. I called back about 3 hours later to complain again. I was told it should be working. No one even offered me bottled water. Finally, 6 hours after I had checked in, I went down to the desk to complain again, and they offered to move me to the airport hotel. This was completely unacceptable, as I was in town for a convention. She then offered to move me to one of the only rooms they had left, which was a smoking room (I do not smoke and do not like to be in a room that smells like smoke). At this point I was willing to accept any room that had running water. When I got to this room, the room number on the door had fallen off and the room number was written on the door with magic marker. Upon entering the room, I found the toilet running constantly like a geyser, making a very loud noise. I had to close the bathroom door and stuff a towel around the bottom of the door to drown out the noise. This went on until about 3:00 AM, at which time it finally stopped. The elevators were very slow, and sometimes the wait for an elevator was 10-15 minutes. I overheard many people complaining about the hotel. In fact, one man in the elevator told me that he travels all over the world, and the Radisson New Orleans was absolutely the worst hotel he had ever stayed in. I have to agree that without a doubt this was the worst hotel I have ever stayed in either. The second day I was there, I was trying to rest in my room in the afternoon when the clock radio in the next room went off. It was so loud that it sounded like it was right by my bed. After about 30 minutes of this, I finally figured out that no one was in that room and I had the maid go in there and turn it off. Then, the next afternoon, the same thing happened again! I again had to find a maid to turn it off. On two different occasions my room key would not work. Twice I had to return to the lobby at the end of a very long, tiring day to get a key that would open the door. The blanket on the bed was dirty and discolored. The bathroom sink did not have a drain trap in it. I dropped an earring and of course it went right down the sink drain. There was mildew around the tub. The whole experience was so bad as to be almost laughable. I have stayed in Radisson Hotels before and have always found them to be pleasant. However, this experience has made me extremely hesitant to ever stay in a Radisson Hotel again. They really should be ashamed to have the Radisson name associated with this place.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Worst Hotel Ever! Where to start? We were without water for a full day: no running water, no toilet flushing, no showers. Management did nothing to help us feel at ease or even offer to comp our stay. We had problems with an internet connection (the staff said we just didn't know how to set it up) and after demanding to change rooms, the internet miraculously worked. They misplaced our display that we had for a conference and after waiting a day for them to find it, stood in the lobby for another 1 1/2 hours for them to bring it to us. And to make the trip even better, someone stole a shirt out of our room that was a gift for my mom. I would not wish this hotel or it's management staff on anyone.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Radisson NO MORE!!!! A friend and I stayed at the Radisson in New Orleans during the Halloween weekend, from 10/30-11/04/03. The moment we arrived at the hotel we knew something was wrong but just couldn't put our fingers on it. The hotel is apparently currently under EXTENSIVE renovations, which is not mentioned on Radissons home site, where we booked our reservations. The indoor pool is closed and apparently will be for some time to come. But all that is small potatos to the hundreds of small black ants that awaited us when we entered our room on the 18th floor. They were everywhere and we discovered how numerous they were when we made the mistake of leaving a some food out on a desk. When we returned that evening they had completely covered the desk and were all over the chair next to it. We called room service to change rooms, but they were booked solid and since it was a pretty busy weekend most others hotels were the same way. Needless to say we had the hotel staff do what they could to remedy our problems, but nothing really came of their solutions, which were to lay down pellets and spray to kill the thriving insect population living under the carpet and who knows were else. As I have stayed in many hotels I would habe to say that this is single handedly the worst experience I've had and the reason I will never stay at another Radisson. I've since written to the Radisson home office to make them aware of the problems in New Orleans and potential health threat, but as of yet have gotten no reply.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: DO NOT stay at the Radisson New Orleans Do not stay at the Radisson. It is filthy, smelly, the elevators are slow or broken, the rooms are tiny, you can hear everything going on in your neighbor's room, the lobby is always mobbed with people....I really have nothing positive to stay about the place. It was so gross I didn't want to touch the furniture or the elevator buttons. The hotel is near the French Quarter, but you have to walk through a pretty bad neighborhood to get Quarter. I suggest staying in the Warehouse district or pretty much anywhere else!
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Unrealized potential Stayed here for four nights while a family member had surgery at Tulane Hospital only two blocks away. Hotel has a deal with the hospital which got us a very deep discount (approx. 50%) so it's hard to be too critical. (Our reservation was totally goofed up by their computer and it took some perserverance to get the right rate, but eventually we did.) I did not notice the musty mildew smell other reviewers have mentioned. It's a lovely old National Register building. Our room was large, clean and well furnished (2 double plus sofabed) but did have a few maintenance issues. Staff is friendly and eager to please but could be better trained. Maid service especially erratic - every day there was something they failed to provide (towels, coffee supplies, glasses, toiletries, etc.). Restaurant very good and reasonable prices; same menu for room service just a bit higher. Neighborhood is a bit dodgy but after all, it's New Orleans. Should improve when Canal St. streetcar begins running in early 2004. It's about a six block walk to the Quarter (okay in daytime). I did not try the shuttle but it seemed to run frequently. Biggest problems are understaffed front desk, rooms not ready at check-in time, and too few working elevators. This got worse when busloads of Falcons fans arrived from Georgia for the Saints game that weekend. If they would fix these problems it could be a good tourist-class hotel. Bottom line: don't pay rack rate for this hotel until they finish renovations and address maintenance and check-in problems. Meanwhile, if you get a deep enough discount it can still be a good deal.
Reviews.Author: IndependentWoman

Reviews.Content: Absolutely awful! Do not stay here for these reasons:- 1: Rude front desk staff (and not enough of them at busy times) - you don't get the room you booked... and they take ages to do anything. 2: 3 dodgy rundown blocks away from the French Quarter. 3: Renovated rooms still have lights hanging out of the ceiling, and bathrooms where the plugs don't work, and the water is either stone cold or runs hot and cold. 4: You can hear everything from all the surrounding rooms but that conversation, TVs, telephones ringing, shower being used etc... 5: The vending machines don't work (had to go from 5th floor to 12th floor to find one that worked)... when they steal your money don't expect the front desk to do anything but say it's nothing to do with us... 6: There are not enough lifts and they smell bad. 7: The hotel smells funny in the corridors, and the ceiling looks like it is falling down. 8: The shuttle bus doesn't call where the timetable says it does because one of the drivers will only go to the first drop off point... 9: The rooms are not cleaned properly 10: They offer 100% guest satisfaction or you don't pay - except you do... when you try to complain they put the phone down on you... US Customer Services merely put you back through to the front desk of the hotel! 11: The phone system goes down on a regular basis 12: The TV system goes down on a regular basis 13: No safe in the room. 14: Arrive to find lipstick on the pillows in your room which won't be ready by check-in time. 15: A hotel manager who simply sits in their office and watches one front desk person struggling to deal with a big queue of people due to a large scale failure of the room key cards.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Never Again!   showReview(1440568, 'full');
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: The Radisson's Got the Blues Stayed at this hotel whilst attending a worldwide Microsoft Conference in early October. Our first room smelt awfully of mildew, was very dark and in need of an upgrade/redecoration. We opted to upgrade to another room, at a reasonable rate of $20 per night, and whilst this was better, there was the horrible smell. The bathroom was in urgent need of being replaced. The view from the window provided a panoramic view of a half empty swimming pool, three run-down grave yards (in fairness some would say that's one of New Orleans attractions), a tenement block and the I10. The hotel is not located in an area that gives the visitor confidence that they will be safe, particulalrly after dark. The locality is very run down, and at night can be intimidating. The room service was quick, but the food was poorly cooked. Breakfast in the restuarant was varied and good. Only two of the elevators appeared to be working (and we were on the 18th floor!) All in all not a good place to stay and given the above seriously overpriced.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
